supplementation supplements to this periodic updating removal and replacement of pages this interleaf supplementation system requires that each page which is to be removed and replaced is identified so that the updating may be accurately accomplished and historically maintained instructions for supplementation are provided for each supplement identified by supplement number date and inclusive ordinance numbers the instructions for posting the removal and replacement of pages must be followed and accomplished in sequence with the most recent supplementation posted last when supplementation is completed and the removal and replacement of all pages are accomplished the instruction sheet should be placed behind the supplementation tab with the most recent instruction sheet on top previous instructions should not be removed so that the user may refer to this tab section to verify whether the code book is fully updated with all supplements included the maintenance of a municipal all supplementation is an important activity which deserves close attention so that the value of the code is maintained as a fully comprehensive compilation of the legislative ordinances of the municipality amendments amendments may be made to the additions revisions or deletions therefrom those changes may be made as follows additions  additions may be made by ordinance to the follows the undetermined the be amended as follows the rocky ford municipal  is amended by the addition of the following set out section title and contents revisions  a revision of the be accomplished as follows of the rocky ford municipal  is repealed in its entirety and readopted to read as follows set out section number title and entire contents of the readopted code section or as follows of the rocky ford fordmunicipal  is repealed in its entirety municipal code corporation preface the city of rocky ford a statutory city has published its municipal a format which features the following the table of contents is the table containing each chapter and article title with reference to page location preceding each chapter is a chapter table of contents also identifying each article by the subject name provided the threeplace section numbering system places the chapter number first followed by the article number and section number separated by hyphens each section may be cited by the chapter article and section number which are in sequence within each chapter the open chapter and page numbering system creates reserved chapter and page numbers for expansion or revision of the code without undue complication when changes are made to the code by supplementation the table identifies the sources for the contents of the code the table identifies prior code sections and their location in the new code and provides ordinance numbers in chronological order and location by section number for the present code contents thus if there is interest in determining whether a prior code section an ordinance or a portion thereof is contained within the code the table will provide that information the index provides references by common and legal terminology to the appropriate code sections cross references are provided with the index when appropriate supplements to the code provide regular updating of the code to maintain it as a current compilation of all the legislation which has general and continuing effect without regular supplementation the code would soon lose its usefulness as a complete source of the general law of the municipality supplementation is accomplished by the periodic publication of additions and amendments to the tallahassee florida state of  colorado city of rocky ford colorado ordinance no 914 an ordinance of the city of rocky ford colorado adopting by by the international inc as adopted in 1 general penalty for violation general provisions  general penalty a whenever in this any other ordinance of this city hereafter enacted or any section rule or regulation prorogated under the provisions of this any act is prohibited or is made or declared to be unlawful in offense or misdemeanor or the doing of any act is required or the failure to do any act is declared to be unlawful or an offense or misdemeanor any person who violates or fails to comply with any provision of this for which a different penalty is not specifically provided shall be punished by a fine of not more than $100000 or by imprisonment not exceeding one year or by both such fine and imprisonment except as hereinafter provided in such person may also be directed to serve community service in addition to such penalty andor imprisonment in addition such person shall pay all costs and expenses in the case including attorney fees b every day such violation continues shall be considered a separate offense 2 application of penalties to juveniles general provisions  general penalty every person who at the time of commission of the offense was at least ten but not yet 18 years of age and who is subsequently convicted of or pleads guilty or nolo contendere to a violation of any provision of this shall be punished by a fine of not more than $100000 per violation or count any voluntary plea of guilty or nolo contendere to the original charge or to a lesser or substituted charge shall subject the person so pleading to all fines andor penalties applicable to the original charge nothing in this be construed to prohibit incarceration in an appropriate facility at the time of charging of a juvenile violating any section of this 3 altering or tampering with   penalty general provisions  general penalty any person who alters changes or amends this except in the manner prescribed in this or who alters or tampers with this any manner so as to cause the ordinances of the city to be misrepresented thereby shall upon conviction thereof be punished as provided by hereof 4 penalty for violations of ordinances adopted after adoption of general provisions  general penalty any person who violates any provision of any ordinance of a permanent and general nature passed or adopted after adoption of this either before or after it has been inserted in this a supplement shall upon conviction thereof be punished as provided by unless another penalty is specifically provided for the violation 5 contempt power administration  municipal court a when the court finds any person to be in contempt the court may vindicate its dignity by imposing on the contemnor a fine not to exceed $30000 and imprisonment not to exceed a term of ten days b in cases of indirect contempt the alleged contemnor shall have all the rights privileges safeguards and protections of a defendant in a petty offense case including but not limited to a formal written complaint arraignment and trial by jury 6 notice to appear or pay fine administration  municipal court a tender by a peace officer or the officer of a summons and complaint or a penalty assessment notice shall before the municipal court at the time and date specified in the summons and complaint or at any subsequent time and date to which the matter is continued or otherwise set by the municipal court or to fail to pay the required fine surcharge or costs c any person convicted of violating this be incarcerated for a period of time not to exceed 90 days or fined an amount not to exceed $30000 or both 7 suspension or revocation  fine business licenses and regulations  alcoholic beverages a the city council acting as the local licensing authority shall have the authority to impose a fine in lieu of a suspension of a liquor license for all or a portion of the period of suspension under the following circumstances 1 the city council has made a final decision to suspend the licensees liquor license for a period of 14 days or less 2 prior to the operative date of the suspension the licensee petitions the city for permission to pay a fine in lieu of suspension 3 the city is satisfied that the following are met a the public welfare and morals would not be impaired by permitting the retail licensee to operate during the period set for suspension and the payment of the fine will achieve the desired disciplinary purposes  b the books and records of the retail licensee are kept in such a manner that the loss of sales of alcoholic beverages which the retail licensee would have suffered had the suspension gone into effect can be determined with reasonable accuracy therefrom  and c the retail licensee has not had his or her license suspended or revoked nor had any suspension stayed by payment of a fine during the two years immediately preceding the date of the motion or complaint which has resulted in a final decision to suspend the retail license b the city may impose a fine of up to 20 percent of the retail licensees estimated gross revenues from the sales of alcoholic beverages during the period of the proposed suspension  except that the fine shall be not less than $20000 nor more than $500000 all fines shall be paid in cash or certified funds made payable to the city clerk and deposited in the general fund of the city c upon payment of the fine pursuant to this the city council shall enter its further order permanently staying the imposition of the suspension d in connection with any petition pursuant to this the authority of the city council is limited to the granting of such stays as are necessary for it to complete its investigation and make its findings and if it makes such findings to the granting of an order permanently staying the imposition of the entire suspension or that portion of the suspension not otherwise conditionally stayed e if the city council does not make the findings required in a above and does not order the suspension permanently stayed the suspension shall go into effect on the operative date finally set by the city council 14 keg tagging requirements business licenses and regulations  alcoholic beverages a any retail liquor establishment selling alcoholic beverages by the keg within the city shall be required to affix to the keg at the time of sale a selflocking plastic identification seal b any retail liquor establishment selling alcoholic beverages by the keg within the city shall be required at the time of sale to fill out an identifying form with information as to the purchasers name address date of birth drivers license number and date of sale the police department shall provide the form c at the time of sale of any keg of alcoholic beverage the retail liquor establishment shall be obligated to affix the seal fill out the form and maintain those identifying records for purposes of inspection by the police department d retail liquor outlets shall keep identifying forms for a period of six months and said records shall be kept in a place open for inspection at all reasonable times at the request of the city e any retail liquor outlet which fails to affix the plastic seal as required in c above or to fill out the forms as required pursuant to subsections b and c shall be in violation of this as such shall be subject to fines and penalties as authorized herein f any owner or operator of any premises who of omission or commission fails to ensure that the owners employees properly comply with this law shall be guilty of violation of subsections b and c g it is unlawful for any person who has purchased alcoholic beverages by the keg within the city to remove the selflocking plastic identification seal required pursuant to c it shall not be a violation of this the person removing the tag is an employee of an owner or operator of a retail liquor establishment or a representative of a vendor of wholesale alcoholic beverages who removes the tag after the return of the keg to the place of retail establishment and after any deposit has been returned to the consumer h it is unlawful for any purchaser of a keg of alcoholic beverage to allow anyone to remove the fixed seal from the keg prior to its return to the retail liquor outlet which sold the keg i it is unlawful for any person to purchase a keg of alcoholic beverage pursuant to the terms of this to thereafter allow consumption of said alcoholic beverage by minors unless said consumption is authorized and allowed pursuant to the laws of the state as enumerated in crs j an owner operator or employee of a retail liquor outlet who upon receipt of a keg being returned by a consumer of the alcoholic beverage shall inspect the returned keg and if the tag has been removed or tampered with in any way the owner or operator shall immediately notify the police department of the same it shall be unlawful for any owner operator or employee to fail to notify the police department as required herein k it is unlawful for any person to be in possession of a keg of alcoholic beverage wherein that keg was purchased within the city and the keg fails to have the appropriate selflocking plastic identification seal as required by a above l any person who violates the provisions of this be subject to a minimum mandatory fine of $25000 and a maximum fine of $100000 m the police department may use the penalty assessment procedure as provided in crs for the enforcement of this 15 minors in licensed establishments business licenses and regulations  alcoholic beverages a purpose  the purpose and intent of this to prohibit minors from having access to or being on the premises of establishments where alcoholic beverages are sold for consumption on the premises at certain times b prohibition  this pertain to any licensed premises 1 it is unlawful for any minor to be in or remain in or on any licensed premises from  pm to closing of the licensed premises for business that same night 2 it is unlawful for any licensee or his or her agents or employees to permit a minor to be in or remain in or on any licensed premises from  pm to closing of the licensed premises for business that same night c exceptions  1 this not prohibit the minor children of the licensee or necessary employees of the licensee from being in or remaining in a licensed premises while the licensee or employee is actually working or performing 2 this not prohibit minors who are members of an entertainment group or the minor children of entertainment group members paid or employed by the licensee from being present in a licensed premises while the entertainment group is actually working or performing 3 this not prevent a minor from remaining on the licensed premises during a private party when the licensed premises are otherwise closed to members of the general public provided that adequate adult supervision exists it shall be an affirmative defense to a violation of this establish by a preponderance of the evidence that a minor at issue was required by the licensee or his or her agents or employees to produce a colorado photo identification for viewing and that the colorado photo identification produced by the minor was fraudulent d penalties  any person who violates this be subject to a fine of not more than $30000 prosecution of a person under this imposition of a penalty under this not prohibit the city from taking other action with respect to the licensees alcoholic beverage or 32 beer license 16 penalty business licenses and regulations  alcoholic beverages any product retail licenses a suspension of license for violation  in addition to any other penalty authorized by law a noncigarette tobacco product retail license shall be suspended if a court of retailer whose license has been suspended is deemed not to have a valid license during the suspension period for purposes of this 1 after suspension for a first violation of this a location within any 12month period no person may engage in noncigarette tobacco product retailing at the location until 15 days have passed from the date of suspension 2 after suspension for a second violation of this a location within any 24month period no person may engage in noncigarette tobacco product retailing at the location until 30 days have passed from the date of suspension 3 after suspension for a third violation of this a location within any 36month period no person may engage in noncigarette tobacco product retailing at the location until 90 days have passed from the date of suspension b revocation of license for violation  after suspension for a fourth violation of this any 48month period the noncigarette tobacco product retail license shall be revoked and the licensee shall be ineligible for one year from the date of suspension to apply for a new noncigarette tobacco product retail license within the city c appeal of suspension or revocation of license  a decision of the city or department to suspend or revoke a noncigarette tobacco product retail license is appealable to the city manager and must be filed with the city clerk within ten days of the mailing of the departments decision if an appeal is made it shall stay enforcement of the appealed action 24 penalties and fines business licenses and regulations  noncigarette tobacco product retail licenses a each such a the remedies provided by this cumulative and in addition to any other remedies available at law or in equity b whenever evidence of a violation of this obtained in any part participation of a person criminal code enforcement proceedings and suits for injunctive relief 27 judgment  relief health sanitation and animals  administration and abatement of nuisances a the judgment in an action to abate a public nuisance may include a permanent injunction to restrain abate and prevent the continuance or reoccurrence of the nuisance the court may grant declaratory relief mandatory orders or any other relief deemed necessary to accomplish the purposes of the injunction and enforce the same and the court may retain jurisdiction of the case for the purpose of enforcing its order b the judgment in an action to abate a public nuisance may include an order directing the chief of police to seize and close the public nuisance and to keep the same effectually closed until further order of the court not to exceed one year c the judgment in an action to abate a public nuisance may include in addition to or in the alternative to other injunctive relief an order requiring the removal correction or other abatement of a public nuisance in whole or in part by the chief of police at the expense of the owner or operator of the public nuisance d the judgment in an action to abate a public nuisance may include in addition to or in the alternative to any other relief authorized by the provisions of this the imposition of a fine of not more than $30000 conditioned upon failure or refusal of compliance with the orders of the court within any time limits therein fixed 28 violation and penalties health sanitation and animals  administration and abatement of nuisances a whenever the doing of any act is required prohibited or declared to be unlawful and no definite fine or penalty is provided for a violation of this any person who is convicted of a violation shall be subject to such penalties as are provided in of this b any person who has possession or control of any private ground or premises whether or not he or she is the owner thereof in or upon which any such nuisance exists or may be found whether such nuisance has been heretofore or is hereafter created shall be deemed guilty of a separate offense as the author of a nuisance for every period of 24 hours continuance of such nuisance after due notice has been given to abate the same c any violation or disobedience of any injunction or order issued by the court in an action to abate a public nuisance shall be punished as a contempt of court by a fine of not more than $30000 and imprisonment of not more than five days  but the municipal court may treat each day on which the violation or disobedience of any injunction order continues or recurs as a separate contempt d fees  costs and fines  liens and collection 1 for seizing and closing any building or premises as provided in this or for performing other duties pursuant to the direction of the municipal court pursuant to the provisions of this the city shall be entitled to a reasonable sum fixed by the municipal court in addition to the actual costs incurred or expended 2 all fees and costs allowed by the provisions of this the costs of a court action to abate any public nuisance and all fines levied by the municipal court in contempt proceedings incidental to any action to abate a public nuisance shall be a first and prior lien upon any real property seized or closed under the provisions of this the same shall be enforceable and collectible by execution issued by order of the municipal court from the property of any person liable therefor 3 nothing in this be construed in such a manner as to destroy the validity of a bona fide lien upon real or personal property appearing of record prior to recording of court orders involving real estate as authorized under this 29 penalty health sanitation and animals  junk vehicles any person convicted of animal in accordance with the provisions of this be a fine of $20000 and the maximum penalty shall be a fine of $50000 the amount of $10000 of the penalty shall not be waived or suspended 1 all of the penalty may be waived where the owner provides proof that the owner properly registered the animal with the city subsequent to the issuance of the summons and complaint 2 where a portion of the penalty was waived pursuant to paragraph 1 above an additional portion or all of the penalty may be waived if the owner also provides proof from a licensed veterinarian that the animal has been spayed or neutered 35 animal disturbance of peace and quiet prohibited health sanitation and animals  animals a it is unlawful for any animal owner or for any person in charge of any animal to own keep or have in his or her possession an animal which disturbs the peace and quiet of any person or neighborhood by barking fighting howling crying whining yowling squawking crowing or emitting any other similar unreasonable noise b for purposes of this unreasonable noise shall mean any sound of such level and duration as to be or tend to be injurious to human health or welfare or which would unreasonably interfere with the enjoyment of life or property continuous or intermittent barking fighting howling crying whining yowling squawking crowing or emitting any other similar unreasonable noise over a period of ten minutes shall constitute prima facie evidence of unreasonable interference with the enjoyment of life or property c no summons and complaint shall be issued nor shall there be a conviction for violation of this there is at least one complaining witness who has signed such complaint and has testified at trial the officer or a police officer who personally observed the behavior of the animal with regard to its barking fighting howling crying whining yowling squawking crowing or emitting other similar unreasonable noise shall satisfy the requirement of having at least one complaining witness and may testify as to his or her observations at trial d this not apply to the officer or police officers in the performance of their duties nor to veterinary hospitals or animal shelters e violations of the provisions of this be punishable as follows 1 for a first violation in a 12month period a minimum fine of $10000 and a maximum fine of $100000 not more than 50 general offenses  public private and personal property a definitions  the following definitions shall apply to this knowingly or willfully a person acts knowingly or willfully with respect to conduct or to a circumstance described by this he or she is aware that his or her conduct is of such nature or that such circumstance exists a person acts knowingly or willfully with respect to a result of his or her conduct when he or she is aware that his or her conduct is practically certain to cause the result thing of value includes real property tangible and intangible personal property contract rights choses in action services confidential information medical records information and any rights of use or enjoyment connected therewith unpurchased means that the item was not paid for in monies or consideration of payment by any other means b it is unlawful for any person to commit the offense of theft it is the intent of this define one offense of theft and to incorporate therein the offenses of larceny stealing embezzlement false pretenses confidence games and shoplifting thereby removing distinctions and technicalities which previously existed in the pleading and proof of such offenses a person commits theft when he or she knowingly obtains or exercises control over anything of value of another without authorization or by threat or deception when the value of the thing is less than $100000 and 1 intends to deprive the other person permanently of the use or benefit of the thing of value 2 knowingly uses conceals or abandons the thing of value in such manner as to deprive the other person permanently of its use or benefit 3 uses conceals or abandons the thing of value intending that such use concealment or abandonment will deprive the other person permanently of its use and benefit  or a if any person willfully conceals unpurchased goods wares or merchandise owned or held by and offered or displayed for sale by any store or other mercantile establishment whether the concealment is on his or her person or otherwise and whether on or off the premises of said store or mercantile establishment such concealment constitutes prima facie evidence that the person intended to commit the offense of theft b if any person conceals upon his or her person or otherwise carries away any unpurchased goods wares or merchandise held or owned by any store or mercantile establishment the store owner merchant or any employee thereof or any police officer acting in good faith and upon probable cause may detain and question any person in a reasonable manner for the purpose of ascertaining whether a person has committed the offense of theft such detention and questioning shall not render the store owner merchant employee or police officer liable civilly or criminally for slander libel false arrest false imprisonment malicious prosecution or unlawful detention 4 demands any consideration to which he or she is not legally entitled as a condition of restoring the thing of value to the other person c penalties  any person who is found to have violated any provision of this be punished by imposition of a fine not to exceed $100000 and imposition of a sentence to useful public service there is hereby imposed a minimum mandatory fine of $5000 for a first offense hereunder 47 violation general offenses  public private and personal property a any cigarettes or tobacco products was presented with and reasonably relied upon a valid state drivers license or other governmentissued form of identification which identified the person receiving the be imposed f any violation of e above shall not constitute a violation of any other provision of this 49 protection of minors from tobacco general offenses  minors a purpose and intent  1 the city council hereby finds that a the city recognizes the dangers associated with youth access to tobacco products  b research shows that most adult smokers began using tobacco products before reaching the legal age at which they could purchase tobacco products  c regulating the sale of tobacco products is an appropriate proven deterrent to protect the health safety and welfare of young people in the city  and d the requirement of retail sellers of tobacco products to comply with the foregoing regulations will not unduly burden legitimate business activities of retailers who sell tobacco products to youth and will not burden the revenue received by the city for the cigarette excise tax 2 it is the intent of the city council to prohibit the sales of tobacco products to youth  to encourage responsible tobacco retailing and discourage violations of tobaccorelated laws especially those laws that prohibit or discourage the sale or distribution of tobacco products to minors  and to reduce the impact of tobacco and nicotine product use by youth in the city b definitions  as used in this the following words shall have the following meanings unless the context clearly requires otherwise retail tobacco business means a sole proprietorship corporation limited liability company partnership or other enterprise engaged primarily in the sale manufacture or promotion of tobacco tobacco products or smoking devices or accessories either at wholesale or retail and in which the sale manufacture or promotion of other products is less than five percent gross sales receipts for purposes of enforcement of this retail tobacco business includes but is not limited to a sole proprietorship corporation limited liability company or other enterprise engaged primarily in the sale or manufacture of hookah or shisha products and related smoking products including but not limited to any plant or other organic matter packaged for smoking or held out as a smoking product or any sole proprietorship corporation limited liability company partnership or other enterprise engaged in the promotion of hookah or shisha smoking sometimes referred to as a hookah bar cafe or lounge selfservice display means the open display or storage of tobacco products in a manner that is physically accessible in any way to the general public without the assistance of the retailer or employee of the retailer and a direct persontoperson transfer between the purchaser and the retailer or employee of the retailer a vending machine is a form of selfservice display tobacco paraphernalia means cigarette papers or wrappers pipes holders of smoking materials of all types cigarette rolling machines and any other item designed for the smoking preparation storing or consumption of tobacco products tobacco product means and includes 1 any product that contains tobacco or nicotine or is made or derived from tobacco that is intended or expected to be ingested smoked inhaled placed in oral or nasal cavities or applied to the skin  or 2 any electronic device that can be used to deliver nicotine or tobacco to the person using the device including but not limited to an electronic cigarette cigar cigarillo or pipe the term tobacco product does not include any product specifically approved by the united states food and drug administration for use in reducing treating or eliminating nicotine or tobacco dependence or for other medical purposes when such product is being marketed and sold solely for such an approved purpose c minimum age for persons selling and handling tobacco products  no person in the course of employment who is younger than the minimum age established by the laws of the state for the purchase of tobacco products shall sell stock retrieve or otherwise handle tobacco products d positive identification required  no person shall sell or transfer a tobacco product to another person who appears to be under the age of 30 years without first examining the identification of the recipient to confirm that the recipient is at least the minimum age under the laws of the state to purchase and possess tobacco products e no minors permitted in a retail tobacco business  1 no person who is younger than the minimum age established by the laws of the state for the purchase of tobacco products shall be admitted to or be on the premises of a retail tobacco the owner of the business establishment 2 the owner of a retail tobacco business shall post and keep at all times visible to the public in a conspicuous place on the premises a sign to be provided by the city clerks office which shall read as follows warning it is illegal for any person under 18 years of age to be admitted to or be on the premises of this business unless accompanied by a parent or contaminants may come into contact with potable water b crossconnection without installation of an approved backflow preventer for the specific type of crossconnection is prohibited c each installed portion thereof during which any violation of any of the provisions of this committed continued or permitted upon conviction of any such violation such person shall be punished by a fine not more than $30000 or by imprisonment for not more than 90 days or by both such fine and imprisonment 74 supervision  penalties building regulations  mobile home parks and campgrounds a the person to whom a may be reissued if the circumstances leading to conviction have been remedied and the park is being maintained and operated in full compliance with the law c any person who violate any provision of violations it is a violation of this any person to do or perform any act which is forbidden or declared to be unlawful or to fail to do or perform any act required in this  292016 general penalty for violation a whenever in this any other ordinance of this city hereafter enacted or any section rule or regulation prorogated under the provisions of this any act is prohibited or is made or declared to be unlawful in offense or misdemeanor or the doing of any act is required or the failure to do any act is declared to be unlawful or an offense or misdemeanor any person who violates or fails to comply with any provision of this for which a different penalty is not specifically provided shall be punished by a fine of not more than $100000 or by imprisonment not exceeding one year or by both such fine and imprisonment except as hereinafter provided in such person may also be directed to serve community service in addition to such penalty andor imprisonment in addition such person shall pay all costs and expenses in the case including attorney fees b every day such violation continues shall be considered a separate offense    292016 application of penalties to juveniles every person who at the time of commission of the offense was at least ten but not yet 18 years of age and who is subsequently convicted of or pleads guilty or nolo contendere to a violation of any provision of this be punished by a fine of not more than $100000 per violation or count any voluntary plea of guilty or nolo contendere to the original charge or to a lesser or substituted charge shall subject the person so pleading to all fines andor penalties applicable to the original charge nothing in this be construed to prohibit incarceration in an appropriate facility at the time of charging of a juvenile violating any section of this  292016 altering or tampering with   penalty any person who alters changes or amends this except in the manner prescribed in this or who alters or tampers with including candidates filing affidavits of intent as set forth in above the city clerk if instructed by resolution of the city council either before or after such date shall cancel the election and the candidates by resolution of the city council shall be declared to be elected b notice of such cancellation shall be published if possible and notice of such cancellation shall be posted at each polling place and in not less than one other public place    292016 election wards the city is hereby divided into three wards for municipal purposes at any and all municipal elections held by the the  election six council members shall be elected the candidate for council member from each election ward receiving the highest number of votes shall be elected for a fouryear term and the candidate for council member from each election ward receiving the next highest number of votes shall be elected for a twoyear term at the next subsequent regular election and at each regular election thereafter three council members shall be elected to serve fouryear terms b authority the city council shall constitute the legislative body of the city shall have the power and authority except as otherwise provided by statute to exercise all power conferred upon or possessed by the city and shall have the power and authority to adopt such laws ordinances and resolutions as it shall deem proper in the exercise thereof c qualifications each council member shall be a resident of the city and a registered elector who has resided within the city limits for a period of at least 12 consecutive months immediately preceding the date of the election he or she shall also be at least 18 years of age however in case of annexation of property any person who has resided within the annexed territory for the time prescribed in this be deemed to have met the residence requirements for the city d removal from office any council member who willfully absents himself or herself from two consecutive meetings of the city council one of which is a regular meeting may be removed from office by a quorum of all the members elected to city council when any officer ceases to reside within the city limits he or she may be removed from office pursuant to this e vacancies in case of the death resignation vacation or removal of any council member during his or her term of office the city council by a majority vote of all remaining members thereof may select and appoint from among the duly qualified electors of the city a suitable person to fill the vacancy in the city council or in any other elected office the person so appointed shall hold office until the next regular election and until his or her successor is elected and qualified if the term of the person creating the vacancy in any election ward was to extend beyond the next regular election the person elected to fill the vacancy in such election ward shall be elected for the unexpired term where vacancies exist in any election ward in the office of council members and successors are to be elected at the next election to fill the unexpired terms the candidate for council member from such election ward receiving the highest number of votes shall be elected to a fouryear term and the candidate from such election ward receiving the next highest number of votes shall be elected to fill the unexpired term     292016 mayor a the mayor shall be elected to serve a term of two years the mayor shall meet the same qualifications as a council member and in the event of a vacancy in the office of mayor such vacancy shall be filled in the same manner as a vacancy in the office of council member as set forth in above b the mayor shall be the presiding officer of the city council and shall have the same voting powers as any council member c the mayor shall be considered a member of the city council and shall be recognized as the head of the city government for all ceremonial purposes d the mayor shall execute and authenticate by his or her signature all bonds warrants contracts and instruments of and concerning the business of the city as the council members or any statutes or ordinances may require the mayor may authorize the city manager to perform any of the duties listed herein e the mayor shall exercise all powers and perform such other duties as are conferred upon him or her by state statutes and this  12112001   292016 mayor pro tem at its first meeting following each biennial election the city council shall choose one of the council members to serve as mayor pro tem in the absence of the mayor from any meeting of the city council during the absence of the mayor from the city or during the inability of the mayor to act the mayor pro tem shall perform the duties of the mayor    292016 acting mayor in the event of the absence or disability of both the mayor and the mayor pro tem the council members may designate another council member to serve as acting mayor during such absence or disability  292016 compensation a the mayor shall receive such compensation for his or her services as set by ordinance of the city council b each council member shall receive such compensation for his or her services as set by ordinance of the city council c the compensation paid to any member of the city council including the mayor shall not be increased or diminished for the term of office for which he or she has been elected or appointed any mayor or council member who has resigned or vacated an office prior to the end of his or her elective or appointed term shall not be eligible to election or reappointment to the same during such term if the rate of compensation has been increased    292016 regular meetings the regular meetings of the city council shall be held two times per month at the rocky ford city hall and the date and time of the meetings shall be established at the first meeting of the newly elected city council no meeting shall be held on any legal holiday    292016 special meetings a any four members of the city council are hereby authorized to call special meetings of the city council for the transaction of all corporate business when in their judgment special meetings shall be deemed necessary b whenever a special meeting of the city council is deemed necessary a written notice of the time and place of such special meeting shall be given to each member of the city council which notice shall be personally served or left at the members usual place of residence by the city clerk at least two hours in advance of the meeting c the city council at any duly convened meeting may by majority vote call a special meeting for a future date notice of such meeting shall be given to any member of the city council not in attendance d should the city council convene for a special meeting pursuant to a request of an interested party for the purpose of accommodating time constraints of said interested party the city council may in its discretion assess fees for the special meeting against the interested party the city council may from time to time by resolution adopt a fee schedule which may be assessed for special meetings said fees shall reasonably compensate the staff of the city and the city attorney for time spent in preparation for attendance at special meetings     292016 meeting rules in accordance with crs the city council shall determine its own rules of procedure and order of business and shall keep a journal of its proceedings the city council may compel attendance of council members and may punish any council member for misconduct  12112001   292016 adjourned meetings a the city council may at any regular or special meeting adjourn the meeting to any other evening prior to the evening for the next regular meeting in such cases notice thereof shall be given to each member of the city council by the city clerk by mail or otherwise b three members shall be a quorum for adjourning a meeting as provided in a above     292016 boards and commissions the following boards and commissions are responsible to the city council and the mayor may establish formal lines of communication with the boards and commissions 1 arts commission 2 board of adjustment 3 library board 4 museum board 5 planning commission 6 rocky ford country club 7 swimming pool commission 8 tree board    292016 article 3  officers and employees division 1  general appointed officers a the following officers of the city shall be appointed by a majority vote of all the members of the city council 1 city manager  2 city attorney  and 3 municipal judge b said officers shall hold their respective offices until their successors are duly appointed and qualified vacancies shall be filled by appointment of the city council  292016 powers and duties of officers appointed officers of the city shall have such powers and perform such duties as are now or hereafter may be prescribed by state law and the ordinances of the city  292016 oath of office  bond a when required by the city council each officer or employee before entering upon the duties of his or her office shall take and subscribe to an oath to support the constitutions and laws of the united states and the state and the ordinances of the city b the city manager the city clerk and such other officers and employees as the city council may require shall give bonds in such amounts and with such sureties as may be approved by the city council conditioned upon the faithful performance of all duties pertaining to such office the proper care of all money or property of the city coming into his or her hands and the proper accounting for or delivery of the same the premiums on such bonds shall be paid by the city the city council may waive the requirements of such bonds  12112001   292016 compensation the salary or compensation of officers and employees shall be established by ordinance of the city council which shall provide uniform compensation for like services such schedules of compensation may fix the minimum and maximum for any grade an increase in compensation within the limits provided for the grade may be granted at any time by the city manager or other appointing authority upon the basis of efficiency and seniority  12112001   292016 removal of city officers a cause for removal by a majority vote of all members of the city council any appointed officer of the city may be removed from office no such removal shall be made without a charge in writing and an opportunity of hearing being given unless the officer against whom the charge is made has moved out of the limits of the city appointed officers or employees of the city need not reside within the limits of the city a municipal judge may be removed during his or her term of office only for cause as set forth in 2 crs b specification of charges all charges preferred against any such officer of the city for any cause or causes specified in the foregoing subsection for the removal of such officer shall be made in writing to the city council and shall clearly specify any such cause or causes of removal c service of charges and notice of hearing a copy of such charges and specifications together with a notice of the time and place of hearing shall be served upon the accused at least 15 days before the day of hearing d hearing at the time and place so set the city council shall meet and proceed according to its rules to hear the evidence against the accused officer as well as the evidence offered in his or her behalf adjourning from time to time as may be necessary until all the evidence has been given e decision within three days after the evidence has been given the city council shall vote by yeas and nays upon each charge and specification separately the question upon each charge shall be is the accused guilty if the city council by a lawful number finds the accused officer guilty of any specified charge aforesaid it shall resolve that the accused be removed from office and his or her office declared vacant f appearance by counsel upon the trial as aforesaid the accused shall be heard by himself or herself or by counsel in his or her defense and the city may also be represented by counsel in the prosecution of such charges the chief of police the mayor or the city clerk may serve any paper required to be served by any provisions of this  292016 city attorney a the city council shall appoint a city attorney who upon taking office shall be an attorney at law licensed to practice law in the state the city attorney shall serve at the pleasure of the city council the city attorney shall advise the city council and city officials in matters relating to their official powers and duties and perform such other duties as the city council may prescribe by ordinance or resolution b the city council may provide the city attorney with such assistants as the city council may deem necessary and may on its own motion or upon request of the city attorney in special cases employ special counsel c the city council shall establish compensation for the city attorney his or her assistants and special counsel any agreement for compensation to special counsel shall be made only upon approval of the city council and prior to the service being rendered  12112001   292016 social security in the opinion of the city council the extension of the social security system to employees and officers of the city will be of great benefit not only to the employees and officers by providing that said employees and officers may participate in the provision of the old age and survivors insurance system but also to the city by enabling it to attract and retain in employment the best of personnel and thus increase the efficiency of its government    292016 division 2  city manager qualifications a the city council shall appoint a city manager who shall be the chief administrative officer of the city the city manager shall be chosen solely on the basis of his or her executive and administrative qualifications and need not when appointed be a resident of the city or the state b no member of the city council shall be chosen as city manager during his or her term of office c the city manager shall be appointed for an indefinite term however the city manager may be removed at the pleasure of the city council for cause 1 before the city manager may be removed he or she must be given if he or she so demands a written statement of the reasons alleged for his or her removal the city manager has the right to be heard thereon at a public meeting of the city council prior to the final vote on the question of his or her removal pending and during such hearing the city council may suspend him or her from office 2 the action of the city council in suspending or removing the city manager shall be final it is the intent of this vest all authority and to fix all responsibility for such suspension or removal in the city council d in case of the absence or disability of the city manager the city council may designate a qualified person to perform the duties of the office during such absence or disability  12112001   292016 powers and responsibilities a the city manager is responsible to the city council for the proper administration of all affairs of the city placed in his or her charge and to that end and except as otherwise provided in b below he or she shall have the power to appoint and remove all officers and employees in the administrative service of the city except the city attorney and the municipal judge appointments made by the city manager shall be on the basis of executive and administrative ability training and experience of such appointees in the work which they are to perform all such appointments shall be without definite term b officers and employees appointed by the city manager may be removed by him or her at any time for cause the decision of the city manager in any such case shall be final  12112001   292016 city council not to interfere a neither the city council nor any of its committees or members shall direct or request the appointment of any person to or his or her removal from office by the city manager or in any other manner take part in the appointment or removal of employees in the administrative service of the city b the city council and its members shall deal with that portion of the administrative service for which the city manager is responsible solely city manager and neither the city council nor any member thereof shall give orders to any subordinate of the city either publicly or privately any violation of the provisions of this a member of the city council constitutes misconduct and is punishable in such manner as may be determined by the other members of the city council  12112001   292016 duties of city manager it is the duty of the city manager to perform the following actions 1 act as chief conservator of the peace within the city 2 supervise the administration of the affairs of the city 3 see that the ordinances of the city and the applicable laws of the state are enforced 4 make such recommendations to the city council concerning the affairs of the city as seem desirable to him or her 5 keep the city council advised of the financial conditions and future needs of the city 6 prepare and submit to the city council the annual budget estimate 7 prepare and submit to the city council such reports as are required by the city council 8 prepare and submit each month to the city council a detailed report covering all activities of the city including a summary statement of revenues and expenditures for the preceding month detailed as to appropriations and funds in such a manner as to show the exact financial condition of the city and of each department and division thereof as of the last day of the previous month 9 perform such other duties as may be required by him or her by ordinance or resolution of the city council  12112001   292016 responsibilities at meetings the city manager shall attend and participate in all city council meetings but shall have no vote therein the city manager has the right to take part in the discussion of all matters coming before the city council  12112001   292016 administrative plan a the city council upon the report and recommendation of the city manager has the power to create and establish by ordinance administrative departments of city administration b it is the duty of the city manager to propose a plan of administrative organization to the city council within 60 days after his or her appointment which plan if approved by the city council shall be adopted by ordinance c the administrative plan shall provide for the establishment of the office of city clerk the city clerk shall be ex officio finance director and clerk of the city council subject to the supervision and control of the city manager in all matters the city clerk shall issue licenses collect license fees make and keep a journal of proceedings of the city council have custody of all public records of the city not specifically entrusted to any other office and perform such other duties pertaining to such offices as are by ordinance required or assigned to the city clerk by the city manager d the administrative plan shall also provide for a chief of police of the officers named in crs all such officers shall be appointed by the city manager as provided in crs e the plan of the city manager shall be placed on file and shall be a matter of public record 292016 division 3  officer position created there is hereby created within the city a position to be called and referred to as the officer  1221996   292016 duties and requirements the primary duties required to be a certified law enforcement officer b the officer shall not be authorized to participate in the investigation or prosecution of criminal matters  1221996   292016 article 4  municipal court division 1  generally creation of municipal court a qualified municipal court of record in and for the city is hereby created and established pursuant to and governed by the provisions of state law  292016 original jurisdiction the municipal court shall have original jurisdiction of all cases arising under the provisions of this ordinances of the city with full power to punish violators thereof by the imposition of such fines and penalties as are prescribed in this by ordinance  292016 appointment of municipal judge the municipal court shall be presided over by a municipal judge appointed by the city council in accordance with 1 crs the municipal judge may be removed during his or her term of office only for cause as provided in 2 crs in the absence of the municipal judge so appointed the city council shall designate one or more substitute judges to serve  12112001   292016 compensation of judge the municipal judge shall receive such fixed compensation as may be she will support the constitution of the united states the constitution of the state and the laws of the city and will faithfully perform the duties of his or her office  292016 municipal court clerk the city manager with the approval of the city council may appoint a person to serve as municipal court clerk whose duties shall be those assigned by the municipal judge the municipal judge may also act as municipal court clerk in accordance with state statutes  292016 sessions generally a there shall be regular sessions of the municipal court for the trial of cases as may be fixed by the municipal judge the municipal judge may hold special sessions of court at any time including sundays holidays and evenings all sessions shall be open to the public b where the nature of the case is such that it would be in the best interest of justice to exclude persons not directly connected with the proceedings the municipal judge may order that the courtroom be cleared  292016 rules of procedure in addition to other powers the municipal judge shall have full power and authority to make and adopt rules and regulations for conducting the business of the municipal court consistent with the municipal court rules of procedure promulgated by the colorado supreme court  292016 contempt power a when the court finds any person to be in contempt the court may vindicate its dignity by imposing on the contemnor a fine not to exceed $30000 and imprisonment not to exceed a term of ten days b in cases of indirect contempt the alleged contemnor shall have all the rights privileges safeguards and protections of a defendant in a petty offense case including but not limited to a formal written complaint arraignment and trial by jury  292016 notice to appear or pay fine a tender by a peace officer or the officer of a summons and complaint or a penalty assessment notice shall constitute notice to that person to appear in municipal court at the time and date specified or to pay the required fine and surcharge thereon b it is a violation of this any person to fail to appear before the municipal court at the time and date specified in the summons and complaint or at any subsequent time and date to which the matter is continued or otherwise set by the municipal court or to fail to pay the required fine surcharge or costs c any person convicted of violating this be incarcerated for a period of time not to exceed 90 days or fined an amount not to exceed $30000 or both  9232003   292016 court fees and surcharges a surcharge a flat surcharge as set forth in the citys fee schedule on all violations of the model traffic this be assessed where the municipal court finds a defendant guilty or the defendant enters a plea of guilty or nolo contendere the surcharge shall be in addition to any penalty assessment and other costs imposed by the municipal court b use of funds use of all monies received from the surcharge shall be restricted to the following purposes 1 the surcharge may be used to pay for the training and any related expense of all police department employees including certified officers and civilian employees 2 where available and needed the surcharge fees may be used to cover the costs of incarcerated offenders 3 surcharge funds may be used for training and education of community members with regard to community policing programs crime prevention programs community relations programs community problemsolving programs and other educational programs dealing with community issues and concerns 4 the surcharge may be used to pay for the acquisition of law enforcement safety equipment as required to ensure the safety of city police officers and citizens c scheduled payment fee upon imposition of a fine or costs by the municipal court a defendant may elect to pay the fines and costs over a period of time pursuant to a schedule established by the municipal court from time to time subject to the following 1 where the defendant elects to make payments a fee as set forth in the citys fee schedule shall be imposed by the municipal court this fee shall be in addition to any fine or other costs imposed by the municipal court 2 a late payment fee as set forth in the citys fee schedule shall be imposed by the municipal court for each late payment d amendment the city council may change or modify all surcharges and fees established in this resolution ac 9232008     292016 division 2  sentencing alternatives purpose and intent the purpose and intent of this division is to establish authorize and set forth the terms and conditions of a useful public service program and home detention program as sentencing alternatives to the municipal court and the municipal judge    292016 definitions as used in this division the following words or phrases are defined as follows defendant means any adult or juvenile convicted of or placed on a deferred sentence or deferred prosecution of a whether that conviction results following a trial or voluntary plea negotiation home detention means an alternative to a sentence to incarceration in any jail wherein the defendant is allowed to serve his or her sentence or term of incarceration or supervision or some portion thereof within his or her home or other appropriate residence    292016 authorization and establishment there is hereby authorized and established within the city a useful public service program and home detention program as sentencing alternatives which are available and may be utilized by the municipal court the municipal judge shall be authorized and entitled to consider as alternative sentencing provisions that any defendant who is convicted of a violation may be required to participate in useful public service within the city or may be required to participate in home detention as a further requirement of any sentence imposed by the municipal court said useful public service sentence shall not exceed 75 hours and said home detention shall not exceed 14 days    292016 specific conditions or requirements for useful public service a for the purpose of this useful public service shall mean any work which is beneficial to the public which work involves a minimum of direct supervision or other public costs in which work would not with the exercise of reasonable care endanger the health or safety of the person required to work all such work to be performed must be of a public nature and no work shall generate profit for any individual or have a direct benefit to any private business organization or individual b no person shall be required to perform community service subject to the terms of this division  however any person who fails or refuses to participate in or complete community service as ordered by the municipal court shall be subject to further punishment resentence or incarceration as deemed appropriate by the municipal judge    292016 factors to be considered in useful public service the municipal court will take into account the defendants health and physical condition  the defendants emotional condition and needs  the defendants ability to do or complete the work to be assigned based on the capabilities and training of the defendant  and the hazards or dangers associated with any particular type of work the municipal court shall be authorized to appoint a useful public service coordinator to assist in locating and assigning useful public service to defendants any work to be assigned shall not be of a religious nature or encourage or express a particular religious belief and the work to be done shall not be considered to be political in nature supporting or opposing any particular candidate for office referendum or ballot question    292016 costs of useful public service each individual defendant who is sentenced as an alternative sentence to useful public service shall be required to pay to the municipal court as a cost of the useful public service an amount as set forth in the citys fee schedule    292016 conditions and criteria of inhome detention the municipal court shall be entitled to impose as a sentence for any violation nonpayment of a fine or contempt of court a term of supervision within his or her home or other approved residence such sentence or term of supervision shall cause the defendant to remain within such defendants approved resident at all times except for approved employment education or related events courtordered activities or medical needs supervision of the defendant shall include personal monitoring by an agent of the municipal court or monitoring by electronic devices which are capable of detecting and recording the defendants absence or presence within the approved residence    292016 fees and costs of inhome detention the defendant shall be required to pay to the municipal court any and all fees or costs associated with inhome detention including but not limited to the costs of any electronic devices to monitor the defendants whereabouts or the additional costs imposed by supervision of the defendants inhome detention    292016 policies and procedures the police department is hereby authorized to develop specific policies and procedures concerning the useful public service program and the inhome detention program these policies and procedures would include but not be limited to coordinating listing contacting and making arrangements for community service at various locations andor for various nonprofit organizations  handling of the costs and payment of those costs for the useful public service program and inhome detention program  and making arrangements for monitoring performance by defendants in both of these programs    292016 article 5  police department creation  composition there is hereby created a police department for the city which shall consist of one chief of police and as many police officers as may from time to time be deemed necessary for the safety and good order of the city  292016 chief of police  appointment and duties a in accordance with the administrative plan the city manager shall appoint a chief of police who shall be the head of the police department it shall be the duty of the chief of police to 1 see that the ordinances of the city and the laws of the state are duly enforced and the rules and regulations of the police department are obeyed 2 direct the operations of the police department subject to the rules and regulations thereof 3 render such accounts of the police department his or her duties and receipts as may be required by the city manager and keep the records of his or her office open to inspection by the city council at any time 4 perform such other duties as may be required by the city manager b before entering upon the duties of such office the chief of police shall take and subscribe to an oath that he or she will support the constitution of the united states the constitution and laws of the state and ordinances of the city and that he or she will faithfully perform the duties of the office upon which he or she is about to enter  292016 duties of police officers all members of the police department shall have power and duties as follows 1 they shall perform all duties required by the chief of police 2 they shall be the enforcement officers of the city and shall see that the provisions of the ordinances of the city and the laws of the state are complied with 3 they shall execute and return all writs and processes directed to them by the municipal judge in any case arising under a city ordinance and they may serve the same in any part of the county  292016 oath of officers before entering upon the duties of his or her office each police officer shall take and subscribe an oath that he or she will support the constitution of the united states the constitution and laws of the state and the ordinances of the city and that he or she will faithfully perform the duties of the office upon which he or she is about to enter  292016 article 6  fire department purpose the fire department is hereby designated as the official fire department of the city and shall be known as the rocky ford fire department the purpose of the fire department shall be to prevent and extinguish fires  to educate the public in all matters pertaining to fires and fire prevention  to engage in first aid and rescue operations  and to care for all fire first aid rescue and other city property in its charge the fire department shall at all times be under the supervision and control of the city manager    292016 organization a new members shall be elected by the consent of the current members of the fire department all compensation of firefighters shall be as provided by the city council b the fire department shall adopt suitable bylaws subject to the approval of the city council for the government of the fire department such as are not in conflict with this city ordinances or state and national laws a copy of such bylaws and this be posted and maintained in a conspicuous place in the fire station    292016 officers officers of the fire department shall be a fire chief assistant fire chief and captain who shall be appointed by the city manager to serve at the will of the city manager and such other officers elected by a majority vote of members of the fire department as may be provided for in the bylaws of the fire department to serve for such time as the bylaws may provide    292016 duties of officers and members a it shall be the duty of each officer and member of the fire department to obey without question the orders of his or her superior officer in the line of duty each member of the fire department shall wear at all times when on duty such distinctive uniform or insignia as shall be prescribed in the bylaws b the fire chief or officers of the fire department shall be responsible for the discipline good order and proper conduct of the whole fire department for the enforcement of all ordinances and regulations pertaining thereto and for the care and condition of the fire station fire apparatus first aid and rescue equipment and all other property of the fire department or in its charge the fire chief shall have command and control of all officers and members of the fire department and all hoses fire apparatus first aid and rescue equipment and other property of the department or in its charge the fire chief shall have control of all persons present at fires and shall have the power if need be to summon any and all ablebodied persons present to aid in extinguishing any fire in removing property from any burning and exposed building and in guarding the same any ablebodied person refusing to obey such summons shall be liable to penalties contained in this c in the absence of the fire chief assistant fire chief captain or senior member present in order of rank and seniority a firefighter who is present shall assume the duties and full authority of the fire chief until the arrival of a superior officer after responding to an alarm no member shall leave the scene of a fire or the apparatus until the fire has been extinguished and the apparatus returned to the station and properly cared for except by permission of the commanding officer    292016 authority the fire chief and members acting under his or her orders shall have full and complete police power and authority at all fires the chief of police and all members of the police department present shall be subject to his or her orders at fires and shall cooperate with him or her in the maintenance of order and safety the fire chief may prescribe limits at fires within which no person shall be permitted except by his or her orders    292016 records and reports a the fire chief shall keep or cause to be kept a complete record of the activities of the fire department and shall make a thorough investigation of each fire and make a report annually and at such other times as may be directed by the mayor to the mayor and the city council giving in detail the following information in regard to each fire if available cause location time owner tenant occupancy type of building insurance carried insurance paid building loss contents loss how extinguished apparatus used firefighters present firefighters absent adequacy of water supply and pressure and any other information of value b the fire chief immediately after assuming office and annually thereafter shall make an inventory of all property owned by the fire department or in its charge including first aid and rescue equipment noting the condition of each article which inventory shall be submitted to the mayor and city council together with recommendations for the purchase of additional equipment needed and any other recommendations he or she may desire to submit affecting the fire department c the fire chief shall maintain in the office of the city clerk an accurate list of the members of the fire department and shall report promptly any additions to or withdrawals from the membership    292016 loaning of apparatus fire apparatus and other city property in charge of the fire department shall not be loaned or rented except by permission of the fire chief    292016 interfering with fire department a no person shall be allowed to enter the fire station unless accompanied by a member of the fire department or by permission of the fire chief or officer in charge no person shall interfere in any way with the fire department in the performance of its duties no person not a member of the fire department shall use any of the fire apparatus unless acting under orders of the commanding officer or firefighter in charge of the apparatus b no person shall knowingly give a false alarm of fire except those for test purposes given or caused to be given by the fire chief or the fire department no person shall interfere with any part of the fire alarm system    292016 right of entry the fire chief and members acting under orders shall have authority to enter any building in the proper performance of their duties    292016 cooperation of water department the water department shall cooperate with the fire department in every way possible to provide an adequate supply of water at pressure suitable for firefighting and shall supply the fire department with one or more accurate maps of the distributing system showing the size and location of all mains valves and fire hydrants which maps shall be posted and maintained in a conspicuous place in the fire station the water department shall promptly report to the fire department the opening and closing of all valves in street mains and any other information relative to the water supply to any and all parts of the city which information shall also be posted for the information of firefighters and others    292016 emergency response authority the fire department is hereby designated as the emergency response authority for hazardous material incidents occurring within the corporate limits of the city    292016 article 7  recreation department department established there is hereby created and established a required to pass under the provisions of of this c the concurring vote of twothirds of the members of the board of adjustment shall be necessary to reverse any order requirement decision or determination of any such administrative official or to decide in favor of the applicant any matter upon which it is required to pass under any such zoning regulation or to effect any variation in of this  392004   292016 appeal from decision a every decision of the board of adjustment shall be subject to review by certiorari by the otero county district court b any appeal shall be filed with the
