within 30 days of the final action taken by the administrative official b the appeal shall be commenced by filing with the administrative official from whom the appeal is taken to the board of adjustment a notice of appeal specifying the grounds for the appeal the administrative official shall forthwith transmit to the board of adjustment all the papers constituting the record upon which the action appealed from was taken  392004   292016 stay of appeal an appeal stays all proceedings in furtherance of the action appealed from unless the administrative official from whom the appeal is taken certifies to the board of adjustment after the notice of appeal has been filed with him or her that by reason of facts stated in the certificate a stay would in his or her opinion cause imminent peril to life or property in such case proceedings shall not be stayed other than by a restraining order which may be granted by the board of adjustment or by the district court on application on notice to the officer from whom the appeal is taken and on due cause shown  392004   292016 hearing a the board of adjustment shall fix a reasonable time for the hearing of the appeal give due notice thereof to the parties and decide the same within a reasonable period of time b at the hearing any party may appear in person or by agent or attorney c the board of adjustment may reverse or affirm wholly or partly or modify the order requirement decision or determination appealed from and shall make such order requirement decision or determination as in its opinion ought to be made in the premises and to that end has all the powers of the administrative official from whom the appeal is taken d where there are practical difficulties or unnecessary hardships in the way of carrying out the strict letter of of this the board of adjustment has the power in passing upon appeals to vary or modify the application of the regulations or provisions of or any other provision of this to the use construction or alteration of buildings or structures or the use of land so that the spirit of the regulations is observed public safety and welfare secured and substantial justice done  392004   292016 article 10  library board creation pursuant to state statutes the establishment of a public library in the city for the use and benefit of the inhabitants thereof is hereby created the library shall be forever free for the use of the inhabitants of the city    292016 funds the city council may appropriate levy and collect annually in the same manner that the general taxes of the city are levied and collected a tax upon real and personal property for the maintenance of the public library said tax not to exceed one and onehalf mills on each dollar of assessed valuation within the city the same to be kept separate and apart in a special fund entitled the public library fund the city may further appropriate property and sales tax for the maintenance and operation of the public library the finance director shall be the custodian of all funds appropriated collected or donated for the public library and all such funds may be used to pay the cost of operation and maintenance of the library all expenditures will be approved by the library board and the city council and paid by the finance director    291999   292016 members a library board consisting of seven trustees shall be appointed by the mayor with the consent of the city council a trustee shall be appointed to serve for three years vacancies in the library board shall be filled for unexpired terms as soon as possible and in the same manner in which members of the library board are regularly chosen a trustee shall not receive a salary or other compensation for services as a trustee but necessary traveling and subsistence expenses actually incurred may be paid from the library fund a trustee may be removed only by vote of the city council    291999   292016 organization powers and duties the library board immediately after appointment and annually thereafter shall meet and organize by the election of a chairperson secretary and treasurer and such other officers as may be deemed necessary the library board with the consent and approval of the city council shall have the power to 1 adopt such laws rules and regulations for its own guidance and for the government of the library as it deems expedient 2 recommend a librarian for employment 3 recommend the purchase of books periodicals maps supplies and materials for the library on the recommendation of the librarian 4 perform all other acts necessary for the orderly and efficient use of the library    291999   292016 annual report at the close of each year the library board or the librarian shall make a report to the city council showing the condition of the librarys trust during the year the sums of money expended and the purpose of the expenditures the number of books and periodicals on hand the number added during the year the number retired the number loaned out and such other statistics information and suggestions as the library board deems of public interest a copy of this report shall be filed with the city clerk and the state librarian    291999   292016 nonresidents and interlibrary exchanges the library board under such rules and regulations as it may deem necessary and upon such terms and conditions as may be agreed upon may allow nonresidents of the city to use the books and other materials thereof and make exchanges of books or other materials with any other library either permanently or temporarily    292016 willful retention of books a person who willfully retains any book newspaper magazine pamphlet manuscript or other property belonging in or to the public library or other educational institution for 30 days after notice in writing to return the same given at the expiration of the time that by the rules of such institution such article or other property may be kept shall be guilty of a violation and upon conviction shall be punished in accordance with the provisions of of this    292016 title to property the title to property given to or for the use and benefit of the public library shall be in the name of the city of rocky ford and shall be held and used according to the terms of the gift    291999   292016 article 11  museum board creation there is hereby established museum board deems necessary and prescribe the duties and fix the compensation of the museum curator and all employees 3 participate in the preparation of an annual budget 4 perform all other acts necessary for the orderly and efficient use of the museum    1999   292016 annual report at the close of each year the museum board shall make a report to the city council showing the condition of the  planning commission creation a planning commission for the city is hereby created pursuant to state statutes    292016 members the planning commission shall consist of five members elected for fiveyear staggered terms all members of the planning commission shall be bona fide residents of the city if any member ceases to reside in the city his or her membership on the planning commission shall immediately terminate all members of the planning commission shall serve without compensation and the noncouncil appointed members shall hold no other municipal office    292016 term of office  removal and vacancies a the terms of the city council members shall correspond to their respective official tenures b members may be removed after public hearing by the mayor for inefficiency neglect of duty or malfeasance in office the mayor shall file a written statement of the reasons for such removal c vacancies occurring other than expiration of a term shall be filled for the remainder of the unexpired term by the city council    292016 voting privileges all members of the planning commission shall be entitled to vote    292016 organization and rules the planning commission shall at its first meeting elect a chairperson from among the members of the planning commission with all members being eligible the planning commission shall create and fill such other of its offices as it may determine with all members being eligible for such other offices the term of the chairperson shall be one year with eligibility for reelection the planning commission shall hold at least one regular meeting each month it shall adopt rules for transaction of business and shall keep a record of its resolutions transactions findings and determinations which record shall be a public record    292016 powers the planning commission shall have all of the powers and perform all of the duties specified by parts 2 and 3 of of title 31 crs together with any other duties or authorities which may hereafter be conferred upon it by the laws of the state the performance of such duties and the exercise of such authority shall be subject to the limitations expressed in said state statutes    292016 master plan in the preparation of a master plan the planning commission shall make careful and comprehensive surveys and studies of present conditions and future growth of the city with due regard to its relation to neighboring territories the master plan shall be made with the general purposes of guiding and accomplishing a coordinated adjusted and harmonious development of the city and its environs which will in accordance with present and future needs best promote health safety morals order convenience prosperity and general welfare as well as efficiency and economy in the process of development including among other things the following adequate provision for traffic  the promotion of safety from fire and other dangers  adequate provision for light and air  the promotion of healthful and convenient distribution of population  the promotion of good civil design and arrangement  wise and efficient expenditures of public funds  and an adequate provision of public utilities and other public requirements    292016 article 13  swimming pool commission purpose and intent the purpose and intent of this to set up establish and create the rocky ford swimming pool commission which will provide and encourage citizen participation in the development of swimming pool policies and swimming pool operations to the fullest extent possible under the laws of the state provisions of city insurance carriers and this    292016 creation the city council hereby sets up establishes and creates the swimming pool commission for the benefit of the inhabitants of the city and vicinity    292016 members a appointment the swimming pool commission shall consist of not less than five and not more than eleven appointed members and two ex officio members the appointed members shall include at least one city council member the city manager andor the superintendent of public works shall serve as ex officio members to advise and support the swimming pool commission and shall have no vote all appointed members shall have voting privileges the city council shall appoint all appointed members including the city council member members need not be residents of the city b terms each member shall be appointed for a term of three years however during the initial year the terms for members on the swimming pool commission shall be either for one year two years or three years as needed to establish and maintain to the extent possible staggered terms of office all terms shall terminate at midnight on december 31 in the year the term concludes c vacancies where an appointed member vacancy occurs the city council shall appoint a new member recommended by the swimming pool commission to fill the unexpired portion of the term d removal of members an appointed member may be removed by the city council on recommendation of the swimming pool commission for unexcused absences at three or more consecutive meetings    292016 compensation members shall not receive any wage salary or compensation    292016 meetings and officers the swimming pool commission shall meet as necessary and shall elect a chairperson vice chairperson secretary and treasurer at its first meeting each calendar year the swimming pool commission may elect such other officers as deemed appropriate ex officio members shall not serve as officers    292016 powers and duties a policies and operations the swimming pool commission shall advise the city council regarding swimming pool policies and shall assist and advise the city manager with the daytoday operation of the municipal swimming pool to the extent allowable under state regulations and law city insurance policies and requirements and this b standards the swimming pool commission and the city administration shall follow the standards set forth below 1 the swimming pool shall remain in compliance with all applicable colorado department of public health and environment regulations state law this requirements of the city insurance carrier and all safety rules established by or required by the city safety officer 2 in a calendar year swimming pool operational expenses shall not exceed swimming pool revenues from all sources 3 the city administration shall take steps to assure that the swimming pool commission receives sufficient financial information in a timely enough fashion to make decisions to avoid a deficit 4 swimming pool revenues shall be deposited with the city which shall use said revenues for the sole purpose of operating the swimming pool 5 the city shall pay swimming pool operational costs from swimming pool revenues except where the city council explicitly authorizes by motion or resolution the use of other assets or the transfer of other revenues to offset operational costs    292016 employees all swimming pool employees shall be employees of the city subject to the city personnel rules and regulations and shall work under the direction and supervision of the swimming pool manager who shall report to the city manager the swimming pool commission and swimming pool manager shall interview and recommend to the city manager individuals to be hired as lifeguards the swimming pool commission shall interview and recommend to the city manager individuals to be hired as the swimming pool manager    292016 contracts for purchase all contracts for goods or services shall be approved by the city council pursuant to state law    292016 reports a monthly reports the swimming pool commission shall submit a verbal report to the city council monthly when the swimming pool is operational b annual reports in addition the swimming pool commission shall provide the city council with an annual written report following the seasonal closing of the swimming pool and no later than october 15 the report shall provide information on the activities of the swimming pool commission sums of money received and expended number of community members served and all other matters deemed appropriate by the swimming pool commission and city council    292016 title to property the title to property given to or for the benefit of the swimming pool commission or swimming pool shall be city manager c the tree board may assist with planting pruning trimming and other care of trees and shrubs located on all cityowned or citycontrolled land including but not limited to street trees and may be prescribed by the public utilities commission of the state  12112001   292016 article 3  sales tax purpose the purpose of this to impose a sales tax upon the sale at retail of tangible personal property and the furnishing of certain services in the city pursuant to the authority granted to incorporated towns and cities of the state by of title 29 crs this be so construed and interpreted as to effectuate the general purpose of making it uniform with the sales tax of the state levied by of title 39 crs    292016 definitions for the purpose of this the definitions of words herein contained shall be as said words are defined in crs except the definition of food in 45 crs and said definitions are incorporated herein by reference    292016 property and services taxed a there is hereby levied and there shall be collected and paid a sales tax on the sale of tangible personal property at retail or the furnishing of services as provided in below b for the purpose of this all retail sales are consummated at the place of business of the retailer unless the tangible personal property sold is delivered by the retailer or his or her agent to a destination outside the limits of the city or to a common carrier for delivery to a destination outside the limits of the city the gross recipients from such sales and use tax shall include delivery charges when such charges are subject to the state sales and use tax imposed by of title 39 crs regardless of the place to which delivery is made if a retailer has no permanent place of business in the city or has more than one place of business the place at which the retail sales are consummated for the purpose of a sales tax imposed by this be determined by the provisions of of title 39 crs and by rules and regulations promulgated by the colorado department of revenue c the amount subject to tax shall not include the amount of any sales or use tax imposed by of title 39 crs      292016 exemptions a the tangible personal property and services taxable pursuant to this be the same as the tangible personal property and services taxable pursuant to crs except as otherwise provided in b below b the tangible personal property and services taxable pursuant to this subject to the same sales tax exemptions as those specified in of of title 39 crs including but not limited to the exemption for sales and purchases of farm equipment under lease or contract specified in 2b and 39267162c crs except 1 the exemption allowed by 1 crs for purchases of machinery or machine tools  2 the exemption of sales and purchases of those items in 1aii crs  3 the exemption for sales of food specified in 1e crs  4 the exemption for vending machine sales of food set forth in 2 crs  5 the exemption for occasional sales by a charitable organization set forth in 1b crs  and 6 the exemption for sales of lowemitting motor vehicles power sources or parts used for converting such power sources as specified in 1 crs c all sales of personal property on which a specific ownership tax has been paid or is payable shall be exempt from city sales tax when such sales meet both of the following conditions 1 the purchaser is a nonresident of or has his or her principal place of business outside of the city  and 2 such personal property is registered or required to be registered outside the limits of the city under the laws of the state d in the event the limitation provided in crs is to be exceeded in the city by a proposed county sales or use tax such limitation shall be exceeded by a stated one percent in the city e otherwise requires act means the federal mobile telecommunications sourcing act 4 usc  116 to 126 as amended customer means a customer as defined in 2 of the act mobile telecommunications service means mobile telecommunications service as defined in 7 of the act place of primary use means the place of primary use as defined in 8 of the act f no sales tax shall apply to the sale of construction and building materials as the term is used in crs if such materials are picked up by the purchaser and if the purchaser of such materials presents to the retailer a building permit or other documentation acceptable to the city evidencing that a local use tax has been paid or is required to be paid g no sales tax shall apply to the sale of tangible personal property at retail or the furnishing of services if the transaction was previously subjected to a sales or use tax lawfully imposed on the purchaser or user by another statutory or home rule city city or town equal to or in excess of that sought to be imposed subsequently by the city a credit shall be granted against the sales tax imposed by the city subsequently with respect to such transaction equal in amount to the lawfully imposed local sales or use tax previously paid by the purchaser or user to the previous statutory or home rule city city or town the amount of the credit shall not exceed the sales tax imposed by the city h no sales or use tax shall apply to the sale of food purchased with food stamps for the purposes of this food shall have the same meaning as provided in 7 usc  2012g i no sales or use tax shall apply to the sale of food purchased with funds provided by the special supplemental food program for women infants and children 42 usc  1786 for the purposes of this food shall have the city any construction and building materials and motor and other vehicles on which registration is required purchased at retail    6241996   3262013   292016 purpose  applicability the purpose of this to raise revenues and provide a companion tax to the sales tax the tax imposed herein of three percent is a use tax on the use storage or consumption within the city of construction and building materials purchased at retail outside the city for use storage or consumption within the city the legal authority for this contained in state statutes  3262013   292016 definitions for the purpose of this the definitions of words herein contained are as defined in state statutes  3262013   292016 exemptions pursuant to state statutes this tax known as a use tax shall not apply to 1 the storage use or consumption of any tangible personal property the sale of which is subject to a retail sales tax collected for the city 2 the storage use or consumption of any tangible personal property purchased for resale in the city either in its original form or as an ingredient of a manufactured or compounded product in the regular course of business 3 the storage use or consumption of tangible personal property brought into the city by a nonresident thereof for his or her own storage use or consumption while temporarily within the city  however this exemption does not apply to the storage use or consumption of tangible personal property brought into the state by a nonresident to be used in the conduct of a business within the state 4 the storage use or consumption of tangible personal property by the us government the state or its institutions or political subdivisions or the city in its governmental capacities only or by religious or charitable corporations in the conduct of their regular religious or charitable functions 5 the storage use or consumption of tangible personal property by a person engaged in the business of manufacturing or compounding for sale profit or use any article substance or commodity which tangible personal property enters into the processing of or becomes an ingredient or component part of the product or service which is manufactured compounded or furnished and the container label or furnished shipping case thereof 6 the storage use or consumption of any article of tangible personal property the sale or use of which has already been subjected to a legally imposed sales tax of another statutory or home rule city town or city or county equal to or in excess of that imposed by this credit shall be granted against the use tax imposed by this respect to a persons storage use or consumption in the city of tangible person property purchased by him or her elsewhere the amount of the credit shall be equal to the tax paid by him or her by reason of the imposition of a sales or use tax of another city town city or county on his or her purchase or use of the property the amount of the credit shall not exceed the tax imposed by this 7 the storage use or consumption of tangible personal property and household effects acquired outside of the city and brought into the city by a nonresident acquiring residency 8 the storage use or consumption of any construction and building materials required or made necessary in the performance of any construction contract that was bid let or entered into at any time prior to the effective date of the use tax ordinances imposing use tax 9 any sales which the city is prohibited from taxing under the constitution or laws of the us or the constitution of the state  3262013   292016 motor and other vehicle use tax collection a the use tax of three percent provided for herein shall be applicable to every motor vehicle for which registration is required by the laws of the state no or its authorized agents until any tax due upon the use storage or consumption thereof pursuant to this been paid b the use tax imposed by this be collected by the authorized agent of the colorado department of revenue in the county c the proceeds of such tax shall be paid to the city periodically in accordance with an agreement entered into by and between the city and the colorado department of revenue    6241996   3262013   292016 construction and building materials use tax collection a for construction and building materials the use tax imposed by this be collected in full prior to regulations that may be necessary or appropriate for the collection administration and enforcement of the use tax on construction and building materials b for purposes of determining the use tax for construction and building materials the total valuation including general contract costs and mechanical electric and plumbing contract costs and delivery fees shall be deemed to be the purchase price of such construction and building materials c if sales tax paid on construction and building materials to be used has been demonstrated as paid prior to commencing construction and has been shown as acceptable proof to the city no use tax shall be due at the time of permitting d for activities specifically requiring a building permit a zoning compliance permit shall be pulled prior to the  292016 article 5  occupational tax declaration of policy and purpose considering the nature of the business of selling products commodities or services the sale of which is regulated by the public utilities commission of the state and the relation of such business to the municipal welfare as well as the relation thereof to the expenditures required of the city and a proper just and equitable distribution of the tax burdens within the city and all other matters proper to be considered thereto the city council finds that the classification of the business as separate occupations is reasonable proper uniform and nondiscriminatory and necessary for a just and proper distribution of tax burdens within the city    292016 levy and schedule there is hereby levied on and against any and all businesses selling products commodities or services the sale of which is regulated by the public utilities commission operating in the city without a franchise an occupation tax equal to three percent of the gross revenue arising from the sale of which is regulated by the public utilities commission within the corporate limits of the city as now or hereafter fixed    292016 filing statement and payment of tax within 45 days after the end of each calendar quarter there shall be filed with the city clerk a statement showing the total gross revenue as prescribed in above during the preceding calendar quarter such statement shall be accompanied by payment to the city of the tax due for the period covered by the statement    292016 failure to pay if any of said businesses fails to pay the taxes as herein provided the full amount thereof with an addition of ten percent shall be due and collected from such business and the same shall be and hereby is declared to be a debt due and owing from such businesses to the city the city attorney shall commence to prosecute to final judgment and determination in any court of competent jurisdiction an action at law to collect said debt in the name of the city    292016 penalty clause if any officer agent or manager of a telephone utility company which is subject to the provisions of this neglects or refuses to make or file the annual statement of accounts provided in above said officer agent manager or person shall on conviction thereof be punished by a fine not less than $2500 nor more than $30000  provided that each day after said statement becomes delinquent during which said officer agent manager or person fails neglects or refuses to make and file such statement shall be considered a separate and distinct offense    292016 inspection of records the city and its officers agents or representatives shall have the right after notice at all reasonable hours and times to examine the books and records of such businesses and to make copies of the entries or contents thereof said books and records shall be made available in the city the notice required by this be in writing directed to the owners officers managers or agents of the business having general control management or supervision of the business within the state or the city and shall be mailed by certified mail return receipt requested which receipt shall be conclusive evidence of the receipt of said notice by the addressee    292016 franchised businesses not liable the provisions of this not apply to any business selling products or commodities the sale of which is regulated by the public utilities commission with a franchise granted by the city requiring the payment of a franchise tax in the city the liability of any business selling products or commodities the sale of which is regulated by the public utilities commission within the city to pay the tax hereby levied shall cease during the effective period of any franchise granted by the city to such business which requires the payment of a franchise tax    292016 successors the provision of this apply to the successors and assigns of any and all businesses as set out in of this to any and all corporations partnerships persons or others furnishing and supplying operating engaging in or carrying on any business of the same nature as set out in    292016 single purpose not diverted the purpose of this to raise revenue for the city and to secure a proper distribution of the moneys to be raised under this this be void in case the supreme court of the state shall hold that any part of the moneys to be raised under this be used for any other purpose    292016 local purpose the tax herein provided is upon occupations and businesses in their performance of local functions and is not a tax upon those functions relating to interstate commerce    292016 article 6  telephone utility occupation tax levy of tax there is hereby levied on and against each telephone utility company operating within the city a tax on the occupation and business of maintaining a telephone exchange and lines connected therewith in the city and of supplying local exchange telephone service to the inhabitants of the city the annual amount of tax levied shall be equal to $550 per telephone account for which local exchange service is provided within the corporate limits of the city    292016 payment schedule the tax levied by this be due and payable quarterly in four equal installments which shall be paid 30 days after the due date    292016 filing statement each telephone utility company subject to this file with the city clerk in such form as the city clerk may require a statement showing the total telephone accounts for which local exchange telephone service was provided within the corporate limits of the city such statement shall be filed within 30 days after june 15 of each year showing such accounts existing on june 15    292016 failure to pay if any telephone utility company subject to the provisions of this to pay the taxes as herein provided the full amount thereof shall be due and collected from such company and the same together with an addition of ten percent of the amount of taxes due shall be and hereby is declared to be a debt due and owing from such company to the city the city attorney upon direction of the city council shall commence and prosecute to final judgment and determination in any court of competent jurisdiction an action at law to collect the debt in the name of the people of the city    292016 penalty clause if any officer agent or manager of a telephone utility company which is subject to the provisions of this neglects or refuses to make or file the annual statement of accounts provided in above said officer agent manager or person shall on conviction thereof be punished by a fine not less than $2500 nor more than $30000  provided that each time the officer agent manager or person fails neglects or refuses to make and file such statement shall be considered a separate and distinct offense    292016 inspection of records the city and its officers agents or representatives shall have the right at all reasonable hours and times to examine the books and records of the telephone utility company which are subject to the provisions of this to make copies of the entries or contents thereof    292016 local purpose the tax herein provided is upon occupations and businesses in the performance of local functions and is not a tax upon those functions relating to interstate commerce it is expressly understood that none of the terms of this be construed to mean that any telephone utility company is issued a franchise by the city    292016 tax in lieu of other taxes the tax herein provided shall be in lieu of all other payments by or fees and taxes on any telephone utility company subject to the provisions of this other than ad valorem taxes and in addition shall be in lieu of any free service furnished to the city by said telephone utility    292016 article 7  liquor regulation and occupational tax definitions as used in this the following words or phrases shall have the following meanings 32 beer means malt liquor as herein defined containing not more than 32% of alcohol by weight malt liquor shall include beer and shall be construed to mean any beverage obtained by the alcoholic fermentation of any fusion or decoction of barley malt hops or any other similar products or any combination thereof in water containing more than 32% of alcohol by weight medicinal liquors means any liquor sold by a duly licensed pharmacist or drug store solely on a doctors bona fide prescription operator means a person licensed by law to sell malt vinous and spirituous liquors other than medicinal liquors for beverage purposes at retail and who is engaged at any time during the calendar year in such operation within the city person shall include persons partnerships associations organizations or corporations spirituous liquors shall be construed to mean any alcohol beverage obtained by distillation mixed with water and other substances in solution and includes among other things brandy rum whiskey gin and every liquor or solid patented or not containing alcohol and which is fit for use for beverage purposes any liquid or solid containing beer or wine in combination with other liquor except as above provided shall not be construed to be malt or vinous liquors but shall be construed to be spirituous liquor vinous liquors shall include wine and fortified wines not exceeding 21 percent of alcohol by volume and shall be construed to mean alcoholic beverage obtained by the fermentation of the natural sugar contents of fruits or other agricultural produce containing sugar    292016 classification of businesses the business of selling at retail any malt vinous or spirituous liquor other than medicinal liquors for beverage purposes is hereby defined and separately classified as such occupation for the purpose of this as follows 1 class a operators are all operators who are licensed to sell beer wine and spirituous liquors for consumption on the premises either as hotel or restaurants 2 class b operators are all operators licensed to sell malt or vinous liquors only by the drink for consumption on the premises 3 class c operators are all operators licensed as retail liquor stores to sell malt vinous or spirituous liquors in original containers for consumption off the premises 4 class d operators are all operators licensed as drug stores to sell malt vinous or spirituous liquors in original containers for consumption off the premises 5 class e operators are all operators licensed to sell only 32% beer and who sell the same for consumption on the premises 6 class f operators are all operators licensed to sell only 32% beer and who sell the same solely in the original package or container for consumption off the premises 7 class g operators are all operators licensed to sell malt vinous or spirituous liquors as clubs this class shall not include clubs which are classified and identified as fraternal clubs and benevolent organizations which operate the same as a wholly nonprofit organization 8 class h operators are all operators licensed to sell malt vinous or spirituous liquors as fraternal and benevolent organizations on a nonprofit basis    292016 declaration of policy and purpose considering the nature of the business of selling at retail 32% beer malt vinous and spirituous liquors for beverage purposes and the relation of such business to the municipal welfare as well as the relation thereof to the expenditures required of the city and a proper just and equitable distribution of tax burdens within the city and all other matters proper to be considered in relation thereto the city council finds determines and declares that the classification of said business as a separate occupation is reasonable proper uniform and nondiscriminatory and necessary for a just and proper distribution of tax burdens within the city    292016 amount of tax assessed there is hereby levied and assessed for the calendar year an annual occupational tax upon the business of selling 32% beer malt vinous or spirituous liquors except medicinal liquors in the city as said occupation has been herein classified as follows operator tax class a $20000 class b 20000 class c 20000 class d 20000 class e 20000 class f 20000 class g 20000 class h 20000    292016 due date of taxes a the occupational tax shall be due and payable to the city clerk on january 1 of each year and shall be delinquent on february 1 of the same year prepayment of said tax may be made in the month of december preceding the due date b upon receipt of such tax it shall be the duty of the city clerk to execute and deliver to the operator paying the tax a receipt showing the name of the operator paying the tax the date of payment the annual period for which said tax is paid and the place at which the operator conducts business c the operator shall at all times keep the receipt posted in a conspicuous place in his or her place of business    292016 proration for new businesses if any operator begins business subsequent to january 1 of any year the tax required shall be prorated on a monthly basis for the remaining portion of the year but no refund shall be made to any person who discontinues said business during the year all prorated taxes provided for in this be due and payable upon the beginning of business and shall be delinquent ten days thereafter    292016 delinquent taxes  interest due interest shall accrue on all delinquent taxes from the date of delinquency until paid or collected at the rate of one and onehalf percent per month    292016 delinquency not grounds for license suspension no delinquency in payment of the tax herein provided for shall be grounds for suspension or revocation of any license granted to an operator by any licensing authority pursuant to state statutes in the performance of any duties imposed upon the city council as a licensing authority by state statutes the city council shall exclude from consideration any delinquency in payment of the tax herein provided for    292016 city may sue for sums due the city shall have the right to recover all sums due under the terms of this judgment and execution thereon in a civil action in any court of competent jurisdiction such remedy shall be cumulative with all other remedies provided herein for the enforcement of this    292016 article 8  disposition of unclaimed property purpose the purpose of this to provide for the administration and disposition of unclaimed property which is in the possession of or under the control of the city    292016 definitions unless otherwise required by context or use words and terms shall be defined as follows city manager means the city manager of the city or any designee owner means a person or entity including a corporation partnership association or governmental entity other than the city or a duly authorized legal representative or successor in interest of the same which owns unclaimed property held by the city unclaimed property means except as provided by any other provision of this ordinance of the city any tangible or intangible property including any income or increment derived therefrom less any lawful charges that is held by or under the control of the city and which has not been claimed by its owner for a period of more than one year after it became payable or distributable    292016 procedure for disposition of property a prior to disposition of any unclaimed property having an estimated value of $5000 or more the city manager shall send a written notice by certified mail return receipt requested to the last known address if any of any owner of unclaimed property the last known address of the owner shall be the last address of the owner as shown by the records of the city department or agency holding the property the notice shall include a description of the property the amount of estimated value of the property and when available the purpose for which the property was deposited or otherwise held the notice shall state where the owner may make inquiry of or claim the property the notice shall also state that if the owner fails provide the city manager with a written claim for the return of the property within 60 days of the date of the notice the property shall become the sole property of the city and any claim of the owner to such property shall be deemed forfeited b prior to the disposition of any unclaimed property having an estimated value of less than $5000 or having no last known address of the owner the city manager shall cause a notice to be published in a newspaper of general circulation in the city the notice shall include a description of the property the owner of the property the amount of estimated value of the property and when available the purpose for which the property was deposited or otherwise held the notice shall also state that if the owner fails to provide the city manager with a written claim for the return of the property within 60 days of the date of the publication of the notice the property shall become the sole property of the city and any claim of the owner to such property shall be deemed forfeited c if the city manager receives no written claim within the above 60day claim period the property shall become the sole property of the city and any claim of the owner to such property shall be deemed forfeited d if the city manager receives a written claim within the 60day claim period the city manager shall evaluate the claim and give written notice to the claimant within 90 days thereof that the claim has been accepted or denied in whole or in part the city manager may investigate the validity of a claim and may request further supporting documentation from the claimant prior to disbursing or refusing to disburse the property e in the event that there is more than one claimant for the same property the city manager in the city managers sole discretion may resolve said claims or may resolve such claims by depositing the disputed property with the registry of the district court in an interpleader action f in the event that all claims filed are denied the property shall become the sole property of the city and any claim of the owner of such property shall be deemed forfeited g any legal action filed challenging a decision of the city manager shall be filed pursuant to rule 106 of the colorado rules of civil procedure within 30 days of such decision or shall be forever barred if any legal action is timely filed the property shall be disbursed by the city manager pursuant to the order of the court having jurisdiction over such claim h the city manager is authorized to establish and administer procedures for the administration and disposition of unclaimed property consistent with this including compliance requirements for other municipal officers and employees in the identification and disposition of such property    292016 article 9  retail marijuana and marijuana products tax purpose the purpose of this to impose a separate and additional sales tax on the lawful sale of marijuana and marijuana products within the city   3132018  definitions for purposes of this the following words shall have the following meanings consumer shall have the meaning attributed to it in section 2b of of of the colorado constitution  lawful retail sale of marijuana and marijuana products shall mean the sale of marijuana and marijuana products by a licensed retail marijuana store to a consumer in compliance with of of the colorado constitution and et seq crs  marijuana shall have the meaning attributed to it in section 2f of of of the colorado constitution  marijuana establishment shall have the meaning attributed to it in section 2k of of of the colorado constitution  marijuana products shall have the meaning attributed to it in section 2k of of of the colorado constitution  and retail marijuana store shall have the meaning attributed to it in section 2n of of of the colorado constitution   3132018  tax imposed a effective  there is hereby levied and shall be collected upon the lawful retail sale of marijuana and marijuana products within the city at a rate of six percent of the price paid by the consumer thereof rounded off to the nearest penny b the sales tax imposed by this section shall be in addition to and not in lieu of the sales tax imposed on the retail sale of tangible personal property pursuant to of this   3132018  collections administration and enforcement the collection administration and enforcement of the sales tax imposed by this be performed by the city of rocky ford   3132018  chapter 5  franchises and communication systems article 1  emergency telephone service intent and distribution of manufactured mixedmanufactured or natural gas or for the distribution of natural gas for lighting power heating industrial or other purposes to which gas may be applied whether manufactured mixedmanufactured or natural with the sole and exclusive right and privilege for the period and upon the terms and conditions hereinafter specified to construct maintain and operate a transmission line or lines for the purpose of conducting into from or to the municipality gas generated there or elsewhere and to sell or furnish natural or manufactured or mixed gas to the municipality and the inhabitants thereof and to distribute the same by means of mains conduits or pipes laid over upon along under andor across the streets alleys bridges public ways and public places within the present and future boundaries of the municipality and upon the extension or continuation of any such streets alleys bridges and public ways and places or upon any new streets alleys bridges and public ways and places that may hereafter be laid out opened or constructed b for the purposes aforesaid the grantee may enter upon under any street avenue alley viaduct subway or public place or grounds and take up any pavement or sidewalk then existing therein or thereon and make excavations necessary for the laying of such conduits mains pipes and appurtenances provided that any such use of said streets avenues alleys viaducts subways and public grounds shall be conducted in accordance with all excavation permit requirements or other regulations of the municipality and shall be made with the least possible inconvenience to the inhabitants of the municipality such excavations shall be barricaded when necessary and lighted at night and such sidewalks pavements or excavations shall be refilled and replaced without unnecessary delay by and at the expense of the grantee in as good condition as they were before said work was commenced c the grantee shall not have the absolute right to cut into or remove any permanent sidewalks but shall be required wherever practicable in laying mains conduits or pipes to tunnel under said sidewalks d the grantee shall not have the right to enter into any public property other than streets alleys and designated utility rightsofway in the municipality for the purpose of laying conduits pipes or mains until it has first obtained the consent of and engineering of any municipal project which may require the grantee to relocate its facilities in order to explore means of reducing the costs to the grantee the municipality shall make reasonable their differences d the municipality will not oppose in proceedings before the colorado public utilities commission just and reasonable recovery of costs which the grantee incurs in complying herewith and regulations a the franchise granted hereunder is subject to all conditions limitations and immunities now provided for or as hereafter amended and applicable to the operations of a public utility proprietary or commercial value the grantor and its employees agents and representatives shall maintain the confidentiality of such information to the extent allowed by law if the grantor is requested or required by legal or administrative process to disclose any such proprietary or confidential information the grantor shall promptly notify the grantee of such request or requirement so that the grantee may seek an appropriate protective order or other relief    292016 force majeure a it shall not be a breach or default under this either party fails to perform its obligations hereunder due to force majeure force majeure shall include but not be limited to the following 1 physical events such as acts of god landslides lightning earthquakes fires freezing storms floods washouts explosions breakage or accident or necessity of repairs to machinery equipment or distribution or transmission lines  2 acts of others such as strikes workforce stoppages riots sabotage insurrections or wars  3 governmental actions such as necessity for compliance with any court order law statute ordinance executive order or regulation promulgated by a governmental authority having jurisdiction  and 4 any other causes whether of the kind herein enumerated or otherwise not reasonably within the control of the affected party to prevent or overcome b each party shall make reasonable efforts to avoid force majeure and to resolve such event as promptly as reasonably possible once it occurs in order to resume performance of its obligations hereunder  provided however that this provision shall not obligate a party to settle any labor strike    292016 hold harmless the grantee during the term of this franchise agrees to save the grantor harmless from and against all claims demands losses and expenses arising directly out of the negligence of the grantee its employees or agents in constructing operating and maintaining its distribution and transmission facilities or equipment  provided however that the grantee need not save the grantor harmless from claims demands losses and expenses arising out of the negligence of the grantor its employees or agents    292016 successors and assigns all rights privileges and authority granted to the grantee hereunder shall inure to the benefit of the grantees lessees successors and assigns subject to the terms provisions and conditions herein contained and all obligations imposed upon the grantee hereunder shall be binding upon the grantees lessees successors and assigns    292016 no third party beneficiaries the ordinance codified herein constitutes a franchise agreement between the grantor and the grantee no provision of this franchise shall inure to the benefit of any third person including the public at large so as to constitute any such person as a third party beneficiary of the franchise agreement or of any one or more of the terms hereof or otherwise give rise to any cause of action from any person a party hereto    292016 severability if any clause sentence or section of this franchise is deemed invalid by any judicial regulatory or legislative body having proper jurisdiction the remaining provisions shall not be affected    292016 nonwaiver any waiver of obligation or default under this franchise shall not be construed as a waiver of any future defaults whether of like or different character    292016 repeal of conflicting ordinances the ordinance codified herein when accepted by the grantee as provided below shall constitute the entire agreement between the grantor and the grantee relating to the franchise granted by the grantor hereunder and the same shall supersede all prior ordinances relating thereto and any terms and conditions of such prior ordinances or parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby repealed    292016 effect and interpretation of ordinance the captions that precede each section of this for convenience andor reference only and shall not be taken into consideration in the interpretation of any of the provisions of this    292016 article 5  cable television franchise division 1  general provisions grant of franchise a nonexclusive right is hereby granted to bresnan communications llc bci its successors and assigns to establish construct operate maintain repair replace renew reconstruct and remove a cable television system across public property in the city limits for a term of 20 years in accordance with the laws and regulations of the united states of america and the state and the ordinances and regulations of the city including the nonexclusive right privilege and authority 1 to sell and supply audio and video communication service to persons within the city  2 to use public property within the city  and 3 to engage in such further activities within the city as may now or hereinafter be consistent with the generally accepted principles applicable to the operation of a cable television system    292016 effective date of franchise the franchise shall become effective from and after the effective date of the ordinance codified herein and compliance by bci with federal communications commission rules and regulations    292016 unreasonably withheld  provided that bci shall have the right to assign this franchise to a corporation wholly owned by bci or to a limited partnership of which bci or other wholly owned subsidiary of bci is a general partner without prior consent of the city    292016 conflicting provisions repealed all ordinances or parts thereof in conflict with the terms of this franchise are hereby repealed to this the authority of the city council is limited to the granting of such stays as are necessary for it to complete its investigation and make its findings and if it makes such findings to the granting of an order permanently staying the imposition of the entire suspension or that portion of the suspension not otherwise conditionally stayed e if the city council does not make the findings required in a above and does not order the suspension permanently stayed the suspension shall go into effect on the operative date finally set by the city council     292016 educational requirements solicitors and dealers division 1  transient dealers peddlers definitions as used in this the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below unless the context otherwise requires canvasser or solicitor means any person whether or not a resident of the city traveling by any means from place to place from house to house or from street to street taking or attempting to take orders for the sale of goods wares and merchandise or for services to be furnished or performed in the future whether or not such person has carried or exposed for sale a sample of the subject of such sale or whether or not he or she is collecting advance payments for such sales  provided that such definition includes any person who for himself or herself or for another person hires leases uses or occupies any room structure building shop lot or other real property alley street road rightofway or any other place or temporary location within the city for the purpose of exhibiting any samples and taking orders for future delivery peddler means any person whether or not a resident of the city traveling by any means from place to place from house to house or from street to street carrying conveying or transporting goods wares and merchandise offering and exposing the same for sale making sales and delivering articles to purchasers or selling or offering to sell services to be furnished or performed in the future person means any firm corporation limited liability company association club partnership limited partnership society or other organization temporary business means a person who establishes a business within the city with the intention and determination to remain within the city for a short period of time only whether such period is definite or indefinite or until disposition of a particular stock of merchandise has occurred transient dealer means any person whether or not a resident of the city who engages in the temporary business of selling or selling and delivering goods and service within the city and who in furtherance of such purpose hires leases uses or occupies any tent room structure building shop lot or other real property alley street road rightofway or any other place or temporary location within the city 1 transient dealer includes those persons not selling from stock but exhibiting samples for the purpose of securing orders for future delivery the person so engaged shall not be relieved from complying with the provisions of this by reason of associating temporarily with a local dealer trader merchant or auctioneer or by conducting such transient business in connection with as a part of or in the name of any local dealer trader merchant or auctioneer 2 excluded from the term transient dealer are manufacturers representatives who supply wholesalers dealers or merchants located in the city merchants who have a permanent location within the city and who hold a current valid colorado sales tax license local area farmers selling produce and persons who are invited into the city by the city      292016 obstruction of street and sidewalk while conducting business it is unlawful for any person licensed or registered as specified article 5  noncigarette tobacco product retail licenses findings and purpose a the city council hereby finds that 1 the dangers associated with youth access to tobacco products are well recognized  and 2 a local licensing system for noncigarette tobacco product retailers selling noncigarette tobacco products is appropriate to protect the health safety and welfare of young people in the city b it is the intent of the city council to prohibit sales of noncigarette tobacco products to youth to encourage responsible tobacco retailing and to reduce the impact of tobacco product use by young people in the city  992014   292016 definitions the following words and phrases when used in this shall have the meanings defined in this the context clearly requires otherwise arms length transaction means a sale for valuable consideration between two willing parties a sale between relatives related companies or partners will create a rebuttable presumption that an arms length transaction did not occur a sale for which a significant purpose is to avoid the effect of the violations of this not an arms length transaction cigarette means any product that contains nicotine is intended to be burned or heated under ordinary conditions of use and consists of or contains 1 any roll of tobacco wrapped in paper or in any substance not containing tobacco  2 tobacco in any form that is functional in the product which because of its appearance the type of tobacco used in the filler or its packaging and labeling is likely to be offered to or purchased by consumers as a cigarette  or 3 any roll of tobacco wrapped in any substance containing tobacco that because of its appearance the type of tobacco used in the filler or its packaging and labeling is likely to be offered to or purchased by consumers as a cigarette described in paragraph 1 above the term cigarette includes rollyourown  ie any tobacco that because of its appearance type packaging or labeling is suitable for use and likely to be offered to or purchased by consumers as tobacco for making cigarettes for purposes of this definition 009 ounces of rollyourown tobacco shall constitute one individual cigarette consumer means a person who acquires or seeks to acquire noncigarette tobacco products for personal family or household use department means the finance director for the city and any agency or person designated by the finance director to enforce or administer the provisions of this when used in reference to a retailer means a retailer who holds a valid current license under this cigarette tobacco product means and includes 1 any product other than a cigarette that contains tobacco or nicotine or is made or derived from tobacco that is intended or expected to be ingested smoked inhaled placed in oral or nasal cavities or applied to the skin  or 2 any electronic device that can be used to deliver nicotine or tobacco to the person using the device including but not limited to an electronic cigarette cigar cigarillo or pipe the term tobacco product does not include any product specifically approved by the united states food and drug administration for use in reducing treating or eliminating nicotine or tobacco dependence or for other medical purposes when such product is being marketed and sold solely for such an approved purpose noncigarette tobacco product retailer means a sole proprietorship corporation limited liability company partnership or other enterprise that sells offers for sale or otherwise offers any form of consideration for the transfer of a noncigarette tobacco product to another party person means any natural person partnership limited liability company cooperative association corporation personal representative receiver trustee assignee or any other legal entity that engages in forprofit or nonprofit activity selfservice display means the open display or storage of noncigarette tobacco products in a manner that is physically accessible in any way to the general public without the assistance of the retailer or employee of the retailer and a direct persontoperson transfer between the purchaser and the retailer or employee of the retailer a vending machine is a form of selfservice display vending machine means any mechanical electrical or electronic selfservice device which upon insertion of money tokens or any other form of payment dispenses product constitutional and statutory authority as well as the citys plenary authority as a statutory city to adopt and enforce ordinances under its police power in order to preserve the public health safety any person to operate any retail marijuana establishment in the city without a license duly issued therefor by the state licensing authority under the colorado retail marijuana compliance with any and all applicable state laws b it shall be unlawful for any person to operate any retail marijuana establishment in the city without a license duly issued therefor by the city council under this compliance with any and all applicable city laws c it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in any form of business or commerce involving the cultivation processing manufacturing storage sale distribution or consumption of marijuana other than those forms of businesses and commerce that are expressly contemplated by of of the colorado constitution andor the colorado retail marijuana d it shall be unlawful for any licensed retail marijuana establishment to sell serve distribute or initiate the transport of retail marijuana or retail marijuana products at any time other than between the hours of  am and  pm monday e it shall be unlawful for any licensed retail marijuana establishment to cultivate or process marijuana on or within a licensed premise unless allowed by the applicable codes andor applicable administrative regulations and the license premises is equipped with a proper ventilation system that filters out the odor of marijuana f in shall be unlawful to display marijuana products within a licensed premises so as to be visible glass a window or door by a person of normal visual acuity standing at the outside perimeter of the licensed premises   classes of city the failure of the city to make such a determination upon the initial review of a state license application shall not preclude the city from later determining that proposed license is in violation of citys zoning laws or any other restriction on location set forth in city laws and disapprove the issuance of a state or city license on this basis 2 for any application that is not disapproved as provided in paragraph 1 of this the city shall notify the state licensing authority and the applicant for state licensing in writing that the citys further consideration of the application is subject to a local licensing process and that the citys ultimate decision to approve or disapprove the issuance of the state license for a retail marijuana establishment proposed to be located in the city of rocky ford will be subject to the completion of the local licensing process as set forth in this after which the city will notify the state licensing authority in writing of whether or not the retail marijuana establishment proposed in the application has or has not been approved by the city   licensing requirementsprovisions applicable to all licenses a criteria for d no mobile facilities and restrictions regarding deliveries 1 no retail marijuana establishment shall be located in a movable or mobile vehicle or structure 2 no retail marijuana or marijuana product shall be delivered in the city unless such delivery is by a retail marijuana establishment licensed by the state to another retail marijuana establishment licensed by the state and the city and such delivery is specifically permitted by the colorado retail marijuana 3 all sales and distribution of retail marijuana and marijuana products by a licensed retail marijuana store shall occur only upon the licensed premises and the licensee shall be strictly prohibited from delivering retail marijuana or marijuana products to any person at any other location e measurement of distance any distance specified in b or c of this section shall be computed by direct measurement from the nearest property line of the lot or parcel upon which a school or child care facility referenced in b or c is situated to the nearest portion of the building used or proposed for use as a licensed retail marijuana establishment using a route of direct pedestrian access f places where retail marijuana establishments are prohibited no licensed retail marijuana establishment shall be operated within the boundaries of any residential zone district of the city as those boundaries exist at the time any complete application for any class of retail marijuana establishment license is filed with the city clerk retail marijuana stores shall only be operated within the boundaries of a c2 commercial zone district of the as those boundaries exist at the time any complete application is filed with the city clerk all other retail marijuana establishments may be allowed only in an i2 industrial zone district on a property that specifically has been permitted for such use citys special review process as provided for in of the rocky ford municipal special review use must be conducted in accordance regulations   signs and advertising a any person or premises licensed as a retail marijuana store shall comply with all city ordinances regulating signs and advertising in addition no licensed retail of nuisances a where a nuisance exists upon property and is the outgrowth of the usual natural or necessary use of the property the owner tenant or his or her agent and all other persons having emergencies a whenever the officer has reason to believe that a public nuisance exists and that such public nuisance constitutes an emergency presenting imminent danger of serious injury to persons or property the chief of police may immediately enter into any building or upon any premises within the jurisdiction of the city for purposes of inspection or abatement b whenever an emergency situation exists in relation to the enforcement of any of the provisions of this the chief of police upon a presentation of proper credentials or identification in the case of an occupied building or premises may enter into the building or go upon the premises within the jurisdiction of the city in said emergency situation the chief of police may use such reasonable force as may be necessary to gain entry into said building or upon such premises c whenever necessary to make an inspection to enforce any of the provisions of this or whenever the chief of police has reasonable cause to believe that there exists in any building or upon any premises a condition which constitutes a nuisance therein the chief of police may enter such building or premises at all reasonable times to inspect the same or to perform any duty imposed on him or her if such building or premises are occupied the chief of police shall first make a reasonable effort to locate the owner occupant or other person having charge or control of the building or premises and upon locating said owner occupant or other person shall present proper credentials and demand entry if entry is refused the chief of police shall give the owner or occupant or if the owner or occupant cannot be located after a reasonable effort shall leave at the building or premises a 24hour written notice of intention to inspect the notice given to the owner or occupant if left on the premises as aforesaid shall state that the property owner has the right to refuse entry and that in the event that such entry is refused inspection may be made only upon issuance of a search warrant by the municipal judge d after the expiration of said 24hour period from the giving or leaving of notice the chief of police may appear before the municipal judge or other state court judge and upon a showing of probable cause shall obtain a search warrant entitling him or her to enter said building or go upon such premises upon presentation of said search warrant and proper credentials or possession of the same in the case of an unoccupied building or premises the chief of police may enter into said building or go upon said premises using such reasonable force as may be necessary to gain entry e for the purposes of d above a determination of probable cause will be based upon reasonableness and if a valid public interest justifies the intrusion contemplated then there is probable cause to issue a search warrant the person applying for such warrant shall not be required to demonstrate specific knowledge of the condition of the particular structure or premises at issue in order to obtain a search warrant it shall be unlawful for any owner or occupant of said building or premises to resist reasonable force used by any authorized agent acting pursuant to this    292016 jurisdiction a an action to abate a public nuisance may be brought in municipal court or any other court where appropriate b except as otherwise may be provided in this the practice and procedure in an action to abate a public nuisance shall be governed by the colorado rules of civil procedure and the colorado rules of municipal court procedure c an action to abate a public nuisance may be brought by the city attorney in the name of the people of the state of colorado and the city d an action to abate a public nuisance and any action in which a temporary restraining order temporary writ of injunction or preliminary injunction is requested shall be commenced by the filing of a complaint which shall be verified or supported by an affidavit a summons shall be issued and served as in civil cases e the respondent or defendant shall not be entitled to a jury trial    292016 abatement of nuisance a each and every nuisance declared or defined by any ordinance of the city or by this hereby prohibited and the officer is hereby authorized in his or her discretion to cause the same to be summarily abated in such manner as he or she may direct subject to the limitations herein provided if any nuisance is found to exist upon public property it shall be the duty of the city to abate such nuisance immediately b whenever a public nuisance exists which constitutes an emergency imminent danger or serious injury to persons or property the officer may order without notice or judicial action that the public nuisance be summarily abated by removal destruction or mitigation c unless a specific provision of this otherwise when a public nuisance does not require summary abatement the officer may prepare and serve a notice to abate on the owner manager occupant or possessor of any property which constitutes the public nuisance or the person conducting or maintaining the business occupation operation or activity which constitutes the public nuisance such notice shall 1 state that if the nuisance is not abated within seven days an action may be brought in the municipal court or other state court to abate the nuisance and that all costs of abatement plus ten percent of such costs for inspection and other additional administrative costs including but not limited to reasonable attorney fees may be assessed against the person found by the court to have caused allowed to be caused or allowed to continue the public nuisance and may become a lien upon any property on which the abatement was performed 2 be in writing signed by the officer issuing the notice and served either personally or by means of posting on the premises upon which the nuisance exists if notice is served by posting a copy of the notice shall also be mailed by certified mail return receipt requested to the owner of record of the property at the last known address d when a public nuisance has not been voluntarily abated within the time specified in the notice to abate the following procedure shall apply 1 if the person notified in accordance with c above neglects or refuses to comply with the requirements of said notice to abate the nuisance within the time specified the officer may proceed at once upon the expiration of the time specified in such notice to commence appropriate legal action to cause such nuisance to be abated  provided that if the owner is unknown or cannot be found the officer may proceed to abate such nuisance after notice has been posted for the period equal to the time specified to abate said nuisance in either case the expense of such abatement shall be collected from the owner of the property upon which said nuisance existed 2 the city may bring action in the municipal court or other state court to have the nuisance declared as such by the court and for an order enjoining the public nuisance or authorizing its restraint removal termination or abatement by the owner or the person who allowed the nuisance to be caused or to continue or by the officer or any person under contract with the city to perform such services 3 the action to declare and abate a public nuisance shall be brought by the city in the name of the people of the city by the filing of a complaint which shall be verified or supported by an affidavit a summons shall be issued and served as in civil cases and any employee of the city who is over the age of 18 years may serve the summons and verified complaint upon the respondent trial shall be to the municipal court 4 a notice of appearance shall be served with the summons and complaint the appearance date shall be not less than 30 days from the date of service of the summons and complaint the trial shall be held upon the appearance date unless the court grants a continuance for good cause shown 5 the respondent shall file a response on or before the appearance date set forth in the notice of appearance 6 upon the date and at the time set for appearance and trial if the respondent has filed no response and fails to appear and if the city proves that proper service was made on the respondent at least 30 days prior to the appearance date the municipal court may grant such orders as are requested by the city however the municipal court shall order that enforcement by the city be stayed for ten days and that a copy of the municipal courts order be mailed to the respondent at his or her last known address failure to appear on any other date set for trial shall be grounds for entering a default and judgment thereon against a nonappearing party for good cause shown and prior to enforcement the municipal court may set aside any entry of default and the judgment entered thereon 7 upon a judicial determination that a nuisance exists the officer may be authorized to abate said nuisance or cause the same to be abated employing such forces and persons as may be necessary to abate said nuisance or cause the same to be abated including employees of the city or by contract or otherwise all other city officials and employees are hereby authorized and directed to render such assistance to the officer as may be required for the abatement of such nuisance and in connection with the enforcement thereof 8 the judgment of the municipal court may be appealed e the remedies specified in this be in addition to all other remedies provided by law    8192003   292016 judgment  relief a the judgment in an action to abate a public nuisance may include a permanent injunction to restrain abate and prevent the continuance or reoccurrence of the nuisance the court may grant declaratory relief mandatory orders or any other relief deemed necessary to accomplish the purposes of the injunction and enforce the same and the court may retain jurisdiction of the case for the purpose of enforcing its order b the judgment in an action to abate a public nuisance may include an order directing the chief of police to seize and close the public nuisance and to keep the same effectually closed until further order of the court not to exceed one year c the judgment in an action to abate a public nuisance may include in addition to or in the alternative to other injunctive relief an order requiring the removal correction or other abatement of a public nuisance in whole or in part by the chief of police at the expense of the owner or operator of the public nuisance d the judgment in an action to abate a public nuisance may include in addition to or in the alternative to any other relief authorized by the provisions of this the imposition of a fine of not more than $30000 conditioned upon failure or refusal of compliance with the orders of the court within any time limits therein fixed    292016 redelivery of seized premises that the public nuisance has been abated and will not reoccur the court may order the premises delivered to the owner or operator as a condition of such order the court may require the posting of a bond in an amount fixed by order of the court for the faithful performance of the obligation on the owner or operator thereunder to prevent recurrence or continuance of the public nuisance    292016
