pressure level exceeded 90 percent of the time based on a onehour period business district means any district zoned commercial in of this activities means any and all activity incidental to the erection demolition assembling altering installing or equipping of buildings structures roads or appurtenances thereof including land clearing grading excavating and filling continuous noise means a steady fluctuating or impact noise which exists essentially without interruption for a period of one hour or more cyclically varying noise means steady fluctuating or impulsive noise which may or may not contain a pure tone which varies in sound pressure level such that the same level is obtained repetitively at reasonably uniform intervals of time decibel means a logarithm and dimensionless unit of measure often used in describing the amplitude of sound and is denoted by the symbol dba  device means any mechanism which is intended to produce or which actually produces audible sound when operated or handled disturbance means any sound which annoys disturbs or perturbs reasonable persons with normal sensitiveness  or which injures or endangers the comfort repose health hearing peace or safety of other persons dynamic braking device means a device used primarily on trucks to convert the motor from an internal combustion engine to an air compressor for the purpose of vehicle braking emergency vehicle means a motor vehicle used in response to a public calamity or to protect persons or property from an imminent exposure to danger emergency work means work made necessary to restore property to a safe condition following a public calamity or work required to protect persons or property from an imminent exposure to danger fluctuating noise means the sound pressure level of a fluctuating noise which varies more than six dba during the period of observation when measured with the slow meter characteristic of a sound level meter and does not equal the previously existing ambient noise level more than once during the period of observation impulsive noise means a noise containing excursions usually less than one second of sound pressure level twenty dba over the ambient sound pressure level using the fast meter characteristic industrial district means any district defined as an industrial zone in of this ninetieth percentile means the aweighted sound pressure level that is exceeded 90 percent of the time or the level that is exceeded for 54 minutes in one hour denoted l90  level tenth percentile means the aweighted sound pressure level that is exceeded ten fireworks means the following small fireworks devices designed to produce audible or visual effects by combustion complying with the requirements of the united states consumer product safety commission as set forth in 16 cfr  15001 to  and  15071 to 150712 and classified as consumer fireworks un0336 and un0337 pursuant to 49 cfr   1 cylindrical fountains total pyrotechnic composition not to exceed 75 grams each for a single tube or when more than one tube is mounted on a common base a total pyrotechnic composition of no more than 200 grams 2 cone fountains total pyrotechnic composition not to exceed 50 grams each for a single cone or when more than one cone is mounted on a common base a total pyrotechnic composition of no more than 200 grams 3 ground spinner a small device containing not more than 20 grams of pyrotechnic composition venting out of an orifice usually in the side of the tube similar in operation to a wheel but intended to be placed flat on the ground 4 illuminating torches and colored fire in any form total pyrotechnic composition not to exceed 200 grams each 5 dipped sticks and sparklers the total pyrotechnic composition of which does not exceed 100 grams or which the composition of any chlorate or perchlorate shall not exceed five grams 6 any of the following that do not contain more than 50 milligrams of explosive composition a explosive auto alarms  b toy propellant devices  c cigarette loads  d strikeonbox matches  e other trick noisemakers  or f snake or glowworm pressed pellets of not more than two grams of pyrotechnic composition and packaged in retail packages of not more than 25 units 7 fireworks that are used exclusively for testing or research by a licensed explosives laboratory 8 multiple tube devices with a each tube individually attached to a wood or plastic base  b the tubes separated from each other on the base by a distance of at least onehalf inch  c the effect limited to a shower of sparks to a height of no more than 15 feet above the ground  d only one external fuse that causes all of the tubes to function in sequence  and e a total pyrotechnic composition of no more than 500 grams permissible fireworks does not include aerial devices or audible ground devices including but not limited to firecrackers police chief means the chief of the rocky ford police department or his or her authorized representatives retail stand means any temporary or permanent structure stand building or other permanent or temporary facility used to sell deliver transfer consign or furnish fireworks to another person not for resale retailer means a person who is permitted under the provisions of this who sells delivers consigns gives or otherwise furnishes display fireworks or articles pyrotechnic to a person authorized in this discharge fireworks in the city      292016 sale of fireworks a it is unlawful for any person to sell offer to sell or possess with intent to sell at retail in the city any fireworks until such person has first obtained a permit from the city for sale of fireworks at retail pursuant to the provisions of this b only permissible fireworks as defined in this may be sold by a retailer      292016 possession or discharge of fireworks it is unlawful for any person to possess explode or discharge fireworks except permissible fireworks  however the city may possess display fireworks for the purpose of an independence day display    292016 application for permit to sell fireworks at retail any person desiring to obtain a permit to sell fireworks at retail shall shall be punished by a minimum fine of not less than $2500 and not more than $100000    1281998     292016 ban on fireworks a when the fire chief determines that conditions are such that the use of in effect until he or she lifts the ban b each firework firecracker torpedo roman candle skyrocket or other pyrotechnic display used shall constitute a separate offense c any person who is convicted of a violation of this be punished by a fine of not less than $10000 and not more than $30000  6282011   6262012   292016 chapter 11  streets sidewalks and public property article 1  sidewalks repair and maintenance the owner occupant lessee or person in possession or control of any premises or property shall maintain the sidewalks adjoining such premises or property in good repair and in a safe unobstructed condition free of snow weeds and debris  292016 snow and ice removal the owner occupant lessee or person in possession or control of any premises or property shall maintain the sidewalks adjoining such premises or property and shall remove and clear away or cause to be removed or cleared away snow and ice from sidewalks in all business districts within the city by four business hours after the cessation of any fall of snow sleet or freezing rain or by the beginning hours of the next business day following such fall whichever period is shorter and from all other sidewalks in the city within 24 hours of the cessation of any fall of snow sleet or freezing rain  292016 article 2  excavations standards regulations and specifications the public works department in consultation with the city manager and the public works director shall develop standards regulations and specifications governing access utilization and restoration of all streets alleys and rightsofway within the corporate limits of the city which standards regulations and specifications shall not constitute a barrier to the use and excavation of city facilities but shall preserve the integrity of the facilities at the least possible cost to city taxpayers  292016 reporting the public works director shall report to city council the particulars of such regulations specifications and standards as soon as possible whereupon the same shall be adopted by the city council  292016 penalties any person convicted of violating the provisions of this be punished in accordance with the provisions of of this  292016 article 3  construction regulations construction by owner sidewalks curbs and gutters may be constructed by the owner of the property abutting upon the same at his or her expense upon any public street or avenue within the corporate limits of the city all such sidewalks curbs or gutters shall be constructed of the same character location grade material and in the manner provided by this    292016 permit a any person desiring to construct a sidewalk curb or gutter where the grades have been established shall first procure from the city clerk a permit therefor which shall have an accurate description of his or her lot the size of the sidewalk curb or gutter and the character of the material to be used in the construction thereof which shall conform to the provisions of this permit shall state the date when construction will commence and the time within which the work must be completed a duplicate copy thereof shall be retained by the city clerk as part of the records of the city and for the use of the city manager and the street supervisor in superintending the laying of said work before construction work is commenced the city manager shall endorse on both copies of said permit that he or she has properly located and staked the same together with any special requirements concerning the construction thereof b no permit shall be issued unless grades have been established in the locality where proceedings are had to lay sidewalks curbs or gutters under the provisions of this under any special law of the state where the entire work in a district is let by the city as one contract it shall not be necessary for the property owner to procure a permit    292016 grades a all sidewalks curbs and gutters constructed under the provisions of this conform to the grades heretofore established or which may hereafter be established by the city manager and approved by the city council said grades shall be established as near as may be so as to produce a uniform slope from grade point to grade point and to secure a uniformity of grade as near as may be city due consideration being given to the necessity of proper drainage b all such sidewalks curbs and gutters shall be constructed under the supervision of the city manager at the location with the material and in accordance with the provisions of this the detailed specifications prepared by the city manager and approved by the city council    292016 business district the following provisions shall apply to that portion of the city designated as the business district which district shall include front street and railroad avenue main street from sycamore avenue from ninth street to tenth street 1 the sidewalks shall be 14 feet in width from the lot line to the curb except that on walnut and elm avenues the sidewalk shall be 12 feet and on front street and on railroad avenue the sidewalk shall be ten feet in width from the lot line to the curb the sidewalks shall have a uniform slope of threesixteenths inch per foot from the lot line to the curb however at street or alley intersections or where necessary to secure proper drainage such different slope may be specified by the city engineer as necessary to produce a more uniform grade for curb and gutter or to secure the necessary drainage 2 the curb shall be six inches in thickness at the top flush with and directly adjoining the outer edge of the sidewalk the other dimensions shall conform to those hereinafter set forth 3 the gutter shall be four feet in width and laid with a downward slope or curve toward the curb of approximately one inch per foot    292016 residence district the following provisions shall apply to the residence district which district shall include all that portion of the city outside of the business district set forth in above 1 the sidewalks shall be four and onehalf feet in width laid 12 inches from the lot line they shall be laid to grade so that if the entire surface from lot line to curb were covered it would conform to the requirements for a sidewalk in the business district 2 the curbing shall be of the same construction and dimensions as required for the business district and shall be 14 feet from the lot line the gutter shall be four feet in width and otherwise constructed the same as for the business district    292016 sidewalks a all sidewalks shall be constructed by excavating to a proper depth below the top surface of the intended walk the trench shall be thoroughly wetted and made compact by ramming until the surface is unyielding smooth and parallel with and four and onefourth inches below the finished surface of the intended walk  provided that in any place where the natural soil so treated will not produce a suitable foundation the city engineer may require the construction of a foundation of cinders or sand and gravel which shall be wetted and thoroughly compacted until its surface is smooth unyielding and parallel with and four and onehalf inches below the surface of the intended sidewalk along the edge then one and onehalf inches thick firmly held in place by stakes thus making a form for the concrete to follow on the foundation thus prepared and within the form cement concrete shall be placed and thoroughly compacted by ramming with an iron tamping to a thickness of three and threefourths inches so that the surface of the concrete shall be smooth free from loose particles parallel and onehalf inch from the finished surface of the walk b the concrete mixtures shall be composed of one part cement two parts sand and four parts of screened gravel or crushed stone ranging from onefourth inch to one inch in diameter thoroughly mixed together until it appears of the same consistency and to be mixed dry before wetting not more than one barrel of cement shall be used in one mixture with the above proportion of sand and gravel the cement used shall be of the best quality of portland cement and the sand shall be clean sharp and coarse and free from earth loam or other foreign matters the excavation shall be made with a shovel and in no case shall a plow be used c the wearing surface shall be onehalf inch in thickness and shall be composed of one part of cement and two parts of clean sharp sand  sand and cement shall be of the quality above specified the cement and sand shall be thoroughly mixed while in its dry state then moistened sufficiently to be worked into a homogeneous mass and the resultant mass shall then be evenly spread on the concrete course while said course is still soft so that both courses will fully unite the spreading shall be done with a trowel and straightedge a dust of cement shall then be carefully and evenly sifted on the wet surface and floated down to a uniform surface the thickness of this wearing surface shall be not less than onehalf inch in thickness when finished and the total depth of cement and concrete shall not be less than four and onefourth inches above the foundation all work involving the use of cement shall be done rapidly and on completion shall be protected from injury and from heat cold and weather until hard set all such work shall be constructed so as to leave an open joint between sections said joint to extend entirely concrete joints shall not be more than six feet apart    292016 curbs and gutters a the requirements for laying a cement gutter shall be in all particulars the same as for sidewalks as specified above except that the foundation shall be five inches below the finished surface the concrete shall be four inches in thickness and the surface not less than one inch in thickness said gutter shall closely adhere to and become a part of the curb so that the curb and gutter together shall make a channel for water b cement curbs shall be six inches in thickness at the top which shall conform to the established grade for curbs the bottom shall be seven inches in thickness and not less than five inches below the gutter line the concrete shall be prepared in the same manner and of the same materials and the top and street side shall be surfaced as required for sidewalks in case one piece of the curb and gutter is a sixfoot length spacing shall be the same as for sidewalks c additional protection to the street side of the curb such as steel imbedded plates or other reinforcement where necessary may be required by the city engineer in the detail specifications d at street and alley intersections crosswalks and other places where extraordinary conditions prevail such changes in the general specifications shall be made as the city engineer in his or her detail specifications as the exigencies of the case may require to secure the most satisfactory results all such detail specifications shall be approved by the city council before work is begun thereunder e all curbs located at intersections within the city installed replaced or substantially repaired subsequent to  shall comply with the requirements of the americans with disabilities act ada and the regulations adopted thereunder and shall be so designed as to provide for the safe and convenient movement of disabled persons including those in wheelchairs    2122002   292016 petition by property owners for improvements whenever the owners of twothirds of the frontage of the lots or lands adjacent to or abutting upon any streets or alleys or portion thereof designated a district petition the city council in writing to require sidewalks curbs or gutters or any one or more of them to be constructed as located and approved under the provisions of this it shall be the duty of the city council to take such proceedings in relation thereto as are provided by law said improvements to be made as near as shall be possible according to the provisions of this    292016 order of improvements by city council a whenever the city council deems it necessary that any portion of a sidewalk curb or gutter shall be constructed or reconstructed because it is not conformable to the provisions of this the city council may upon its own motion order that said sidewalk curb gutter or any one or more of them be constructed or reconstructed as the case may be said order may be by resolution or by ordinance duly passed in relation thereto said order shall describe the place where said sidewalk curb or gutter is to be constructed  that in the opinion of the city council said improvement is necessary  and further that if the same is not done by the property owner within 30 days from the date of said resolution or publication of said ordinance the city will construct or reconstruct the same or cause said work to be done and charge the cost thereof against the adjacent property and the owner thereof and certify and collect the same as provided by law b in case the order is by ordinance the publication thereof shall be notice to all persons affected thereby of the contents and requirements thereof as to making such improvements if the order is by resolution notice of the same shall be served upon the owner of the property to be assessed by delivering a copy of said resolution in person or by mailing the same to said owner    292016 special assessment of costs if any person fails or refuses to construct any sidewalk curb or gutter in front of his or her premises when so ordered and within the time so provided the city council shall proceed to construct the same by contract which contract shall include all portions of said improvement not constructed by the owner of the property adjacent thereto described in said ordinance or resolution when completed the entire cost shall be ascertained and assessed proportionately against the adjacent lot or land and the owner thereof  and thereupon it shall be the duty of the city clerk to extend said assessment in a book to be kept for that purpose if the same is not paid by the owner within 30 days it shall be the duty of the city clerk to certify said assessment to the county treasurer who shall extend the same upon the tax roll and collect the assessment in the same way as other taxes against said property provided that the approximate amount to be assessed upon the several lots or parcels of property within the district    292016 advertisement of improvements as soon as the plans and specifications have been approved by said advertisement shall set forth the nature and extent of the proposed improvement  that plans and specifications therefor are on file in the office of the city clerk and may be seen and examined by any interested person  the time during which bids will be received for the work which time shall not be less than ten days from the date of the first publication of said advertisement  and the time be assessed of the time and place of opening bids    292016 contract requirements at the time and place set forth in the advertisement the bids received shall be opened by the city council and the a greater sum than the estimated cost of the city engineer if no bid received is acceptable to the city council the city may order advertisements for new bids or it may proceed to construct the work superintendent of water and wastewater crossconnection  in this means any point in the water distribution system where chemical biological or radiological contaminants may come into contact with potable water b crossconnection without installation of an approved backflow preventer for the specific type of crossconnection is prohibited c each installed backflow preventer shall be tested annually by a certified backflow prevention technician d backflow preventer testing and maintenance records shall be kept for three years from the date of testing or maintenance e the water supply to any crossconnection without an approved backflow preventer shall be shut off where the crossconnection is not disconnected or a backflow preventer installed and shall not be reconnected until the crossconnection is disconnected or an approved backflow preventer is installed and the corrective measure is inspected by the superintendent of water and wastewater f the city manager shall inform the colorado department of public health and environment of the uncontrolled crossconnection and the corrective action being taken g any person who violates this be subject to a minimum fine of $10000 and remove any of these items at its option and at charges to be determined by the city by resolution  9281999   292016 sealing of containers all bags of garbage or refuse or a combination thereof shall for collection it need not be fastened at the top if it is at all times kept in a metal container or other receptacle approved by the city which container shall have a tightfitting lid and no defect sufficient to allow the intrusion of flies rodents and insects therein  9281999   292016 placement for collection a garbage and refuse in proper containers as herein provided for shall be placed out for collection at a convenient place in the alley or on the property of the user adjacent to the street and alley or at such other convenient place as the city may from time to time determine with respect to individual properties or users b the city may permit a user to place said container at a place selected by the user  provided however that if said spot selected is more than ten feet from the spot for collection designated by the city the city may make an additional charge to the user over and above the regular collection charge  9281999   292016 frequency of collection collection shall be made at such times and frequencies as the city may from time to time determine acting in its administrative capacity  9281999   292016 authorization for collection of fees a the city council shall by resolution establish charges for collection service for removal and hauling of garbage and refuse in the city prescribe the time and manner of payment of such charges and adopt measures or regulations designed to enforce the payment thereof as in its discretion are necessary or desirable such resolution when adopted shall be of the same force and effect as if incorporated in this b charges for garbage and refuse removed shall be a lien on the property served until paid in full if payment of any such charge is not made within 90 days after the same is due the city clerk shall cause a notice of such charge to be given to the owner of such property by publishing the same for two consecutive weeks in a local newspaper stating the amount of the charges if the same are not paid within ten days thereafter along with publication charges the city clerk shall certify such charges as assessed to the county treasurer to be placed on the tax rolls for the current year to be collected in the same manner as taxes are collected with a penalty of ten percent to defray the cost of collection as provided by state law  9281999   292016 billings the collection fees enumerated above shall be billed monthly in arrears as a part of the water bill for each month  9281999   292016 liability of property owner  charges to constitute lien  action to collect charge whether garbage and refuse are collected and removed by employees of the city or by persons under contract with the city for such purposes in all instances where garbage or refuse is accumulated in any business establishment house dwelling or building where housekeeping cooking or eating is done the owner of such property shall be held personally liable for all charges imposed under this the time such charges are due such charges shall become and remain a lien upon any such buildings or lots until such charges are paid and such charges may be collected from any owner by an action at law or in equity such action to be in the name of the city any such action may be prosecuted in any court having jurisdiction and the action may be for the enforcement of the lien such lien shall attach to such buildings or lots upon which the garbage or refuse is procured accumulated or kept the property owner andor customer of the city shall be liable for all costs expenses and reasonable attorneys fees incurred by the city in prosecuting any action for enforcement of this collection of any fees associated herewith  9281999   292016 determination by resolution the city council may by resolution duly frequencies and route of collection by the city and the hours the city dump shall be open 6 fees for removal andor collection 7 land use fees 8 establishment of other regulations deemed necessary and appropriate for garbage and refuse collection and removal in the city 9 such other matters as may be necessary to effectively implement the provisions of this  9281999   292016 disturbing containers   292016 depositing garbage or refuse on public places or vacant lots prohibited it is unlawful for any person to throw keep place or deposit or cause to be deposited any garbage or refuse upon any countywide landfill as set forth in the citys fee schedule this fee shall apply to all persons in possession of or ownership of any dwelling apartment house store business or other mercantile establishment regardless of whether the city provides garbage collection and removal services to that person  9281999   292016 penalties it is unlawful for any persons to violate any provision of this person violating the same shall upon conviction be punished in accordance with the provisions of of this    292016 article 7  water enterprise establishment of enterprise there is hereby established pursuant to the terms and provisions of the water activity law of title 37 crs the city of rocky ford water enterprise the enterprise the enterprise shall consist of the system which is the business represented by all of the citys water facilities and properties now owned or hereafter acquired whether situated within or without the city boundaries including all present or future improvements extensions enlargements betterments replacements or additions thereof or thereto the enterprise shall have all of the authority powers rights obligations and duties as may be provided or permitted by the water activity law and the colorado constitution and as may be further prescribed by ordinance or resolution of the city council  6102008   292016 governing body the governing body of the enterprise the governing body shall be the city council and shall be subject to all of the applicable laws rules and regulations pertaining to the city council whenever the city council is in session the governing body shall also be deemed to be in session it shall not be necessary for the governing body to meet separately from the regular and special meetings of the city council nor shall it be necessary for the governing body to specifically announce or acknowledge that actions taken thereby are taken by the governing body of the enterprise the governing body may conduct its affairs in the same manner and subject to the same laws which apply to the city council for the same or similar matters  provided that in accordance with 2 crs the governing body may authorize the issuance of bonds by adoption of a resolution  6102008   292016 maintenance of enterprise status the enterprise shall at all times and in all ways conduct its affairs so as to continue to qualify as a water activity enterprise within the meaning of crs and as an enterprise within the meaning of of the colorado constitution specifically but not by way of limitation the enterprise is not authorized to and shall not receive ten percent or more of its annual revenue in grants from all state and local governments combined  6102008   292016 issuance of bonds the enterprise is authorized to issue bonds notes or other obligations payable from the revenues derived or to be derived from the water system in accordance with the water activity law the city council may also authorize the issuance of such bonds notes or other obligations in accordance with the laws of the state and in so doing shall be deemed to be acting as both the governing body and the city council  6102008   292016 water enterprise fees and charges the city council shall adopt by resolution for and on behalf of the enterprise the following rates fees and charges 1 minimum and sufficient water rates  2 plant investment fees  and 3 other fees and charges as the city council deems necessary to cover the cost of inspection testing fees for engineering design review operations maintenance and extensions of the water system  6102008   292016 water enterprise annual budget the city council shall adopted an annual budget for the enterprise separate from the citys general fund budget  6102008   292016 water revenue fund established a there is hereby established an enterprise fund to be known as the water revenue fund in which shall be deposited all revenues from water billing and other revenues related to the water system all funds received from the water rates shall be used only for the operation maintenance debt service replacement of and additions to the system all amounts on hand in such fund shall be invested by the city council in investments proper for public funds b the enterprise may pledge all or any portion of the water revenue fund including revenues anticipated to be collected to the payment of principal interest premium if any and reserves for revenue bonds or any other obligations lawfully issued or otherwise contracted for by the enterprise for the payment or other financing of costs of the water system or for the purpose of refunding any obligations issued or otherwise contracted for such purpose  6102008   292016 article 8  sewer enterprise establishment of enterprise there is hereby purpose the purpose of this to establish a procedure to bring land under the jurisdiction of the city in compliance with the colorado municipal annexation act of 196 as amended  292016 responsibilities of applicant in addition to other duties imposed upon all applicants by this the colorado municipal annexation act of 196 as amended all applicants shall have the following responsibilities 1 the applicant is responsible for having a representative at all meetings where the request is reviewed failure to have a representative present will be cause to have the item withdrawn from the agenda of that meeting 2 the applicant shall consult with the planning department to discuss any special conditions pertaining to the annexation and to obtain an annexation petition  292016 preliminary steps a procedure at least 15 days prior to the presentation of any annexation petition to the city council the applicant shall submit to the city the annexation petition the annexation fee as set forth in the citys fee schedule a minimum of 15 copies of the master plan and annexation map and a minimum of five copies of all required supportive information 1 the planning department shall review all documents submitted for completeness and accuracy if all documents are complete and accurate the planning department shall submit the annexation petition to the city clerk 2 the city clerk shall present the annexation petition and a resolution initiating annexation proceedings to the city council which shall thereafter establish a date for a public hearing upon the establishment of a public hearing date the city clerk shall give appropriate notice in accordance with the colorado municipal annexation act of 196 as amended and shall specifically direct copies of the annexation petition and the resolution initiating the annexation procedure by certified mail to the clerk of the board of county commissioners and to the county attorney copies of the annexation petition and the resolution initiating the annexation procedure shall also be sent by certified mail to any school district or special district having territory within the annexed area these copies shall be sent at least 25 days prior to the public hearing 3 upon acceptance of the annexation petition by the city council the planning department shall furnish to the entities listed below copies of the annexation map and the master plan the planning department may submit copies of the annexation map and the master plan to additional interested entities as determined by the planning department in its sole discretion such entities shall be advised by the planning department of the scheduled hearing date and shall further be notified that any objections to the annexation and master plan must be submitted to the city in writing no later than seven days after receipt of the annexation map and master plan a telephone companies b franchise utility companies c city engineer d fire department e city water and sewer department f colorado department of transportation 4 the planning commission shall review the annexation map master plan and zoning request at a public hearing and shall submit a written recommendation to the city council b annexation map all annexation maps shall be made with an engineers scale minimum scale to be one inch represents 100 feet and shall be on a reproducible medium with outer dimensions of 24 by 36 inches the annexation map shall contain the following information 1 the date of preparation the scale and a symbol designating true north 2 the name of the annexation 3 the names addresses and phone numbers of the applicant and the person responsible for preparing the annexation map 4 the legal description 5 distinction of the boundary that is contiguous to the city and the length of the same 6 lot and block numbers if the area is already platted 7 existing and proposed easements and rightsofway 8 existing and requested zoning and acreage of each requested zone 9 ownership of all parcels within and adjacent to the annexation 10 appropriate certification blocks as directed by the planning department c master plan all master plans shall be made with an engineers scale minimum scale to be one inch represents 100 feet and shall be on a reproducible medium with outer dimensions of 24 by 36 inches the master plan shall contain the following information 1 the date of preparation the scale and a symbol designating true north 2 the name of the annexation 3 the names addresses and phone numbers of the applicant and the person responsible for preparing the master plan 4 existing and proposed easements and rightsofway 5 block numbers and lot numbers with approximate dimensions 6 proposed gross and net residential density 7 existing watercourses with adequate easements for flood control 8 designation of all public sites to be reserved and dedicated 9 existing twofoot contours 10 appropriate certification blocks as directed by the planning department d supportive information the following supportive information shall be submitted with the annexation map and master plan 1 soils description and limitation 2 preliminary utility plan 3 mailing addresses of all property owners within 300 feet of the annexation 4 affidavit concerning the amount and historical use of all water rights owned 5 vicinity map with a radius of one and onehalf miles at a minimum scale of 1 inch represents 2000 feet 6 statement on community need for proposed annexation and zoning 7 for all annexations in excess of ten acres the applicant shall obtain from the school district governing the area to be annexed a statement of the effect of the annexation upon the school district including an estimate of the number of students generated by the proposed annexation and the capital construction required to educate such students  292016 annexation impact report a for all annexations in excess of ten acres the city shall prepare an impact report regarding the proposed annexation not less than 25 days before the date of the annexation hearing one copy of the impact report shall be filed with the board of county commissioners governing the area proposed to be annexed within five days thereafter the preparation and filing of the annexation impact report may be waived upon approval of the board of county commissioners governing the area proposed to be annexed b the annexation impact report shall include the following 1 a map or maps of the city and adjacent territory showing the following information a the present and proposed boundaries of the city in the vicinity of the proposed annexation b the present streets major trunk water lines sewer interceptors and outfalls other utility lines and ditches and the proposed extension of such streets and utility lines in the vicinity of the proposed annexation c the existing and proposed land use pattern in the areas to be annexed 2 a copy of any draft or final preannexation agreement if available 3 a statement of the citys plans for extending or providing for municipal services within the area to be annexed 4 a statement of the citys plans for the financing of municipal services to be extended into the area to be annexed 5 a statement identifying all existing districts within the area to be annexed 6 a statement of the effect of the annexation upon the school district governing the area to be annexed as is more fully set forth in paragraph 15130d7 above  292016 consideration of annexation ordinance upon the submission of documentation in accordance with this upon compliance with the notice and hearing requirements as set forth in the colorado municipal annexation act of 196 as amended the city council may consider the approval of an ordinance annexing the subject property to the city in the event the city council considers and disapproves such ordinance no similar request may be heard for a period of one year from the date of denial  292016 final submission of documents in the event the city council approves an annexation ordinance the applicant shall submit to the planning department two mylars of the final annexation map and two mylars of the master plan within ten days of the effective date of the annexation ordinance  292016 chapter 16  zoning article 1  general provisions title this be known and cited as the rocky ford zoning     292016 authority crs authorizes the governing body of the city the city council to provide for the zoning of all or parts of the incorporated portion of the city    292016 purpose the regulations contained herein are necessary to encourage the most appropriate uses of land  to maintain and stabilize the value of property  to reduce fire hazards improve public safety and lifeguard the public health  and to create a stable pattern of land uses which can be easily and equitably serviced in the interpretation and application of the provisions of this they shall be held to be the minimum requirements for the promotion of the public health safety morals and general welfare    292016 application this regulates and restricts the height number of stories and size of buildings and other structures  the percentage of the lot that may be occupied  the size of the yards courts and other open spaces  the density of population  and the location and use of buildings structures and land for trade industry residence or other purposes within the incorporated areas of the city except as otherwise provided no zoning permit shall be issued for a use not specifically mentioned or described unless in the judgment of the zoning administrator the proposed use is similar to a listed use    292016 classification of districts for the purpose of this the city is divided into zoning districts designed as follows districts abbreviated designations singlefamily residential r1 residential medium density r2 mixed residential r3 local commercial c1 highway commercial c2 light industrial i1 industrial i2 floodplain f1    292016 zoning map a the location and boundaries of the districts designated in above are hereby established as shown on zoning map the city hereinafter referred to as the zoning map b the zoning map and all the notations thereon are hereby made part of this    292016 words and terms when not inconsistent with the content words used in the present tense include the future words in the singular number include the plural number and the masculine includes the feminine additionally 1 the word shall is mandatory 2 the word may is permissive 3 the word person includes a firm association organization partnership trust company corporation or other legal entity as well as an individual 4 whenever the words dwelling dwelling unit  rooming house  rooming unit or premises are used they shall be construed as though they were followed by the words or any part thereof  5 the word building includes the word structure   the term use includes the words arranged  designed or intended to be used   and the term occupied includes the words arranged  designed or intended to be occupied  6 if a term or word causes difficulties in interpretation and is not herein defined or properly described the planning commission shall define the terms and recommend to the city council that it amend this include an appropriate definition    292016 definitions for the purpose of this certain words and terms are hereby defined as follows abandoned vehicle means any vehicle left within the limits of any street road highway or alley or upon property of another without the consent of the owner of such property for a period of 24 hours or longer a vehicle shall not be considered abandoned if its owner or operator is unable to remove it from the place where it is located and so notifies law enforcement officials and requests assistance  thus a properly licensed operable vehicle shall not be abandoned if the vehicle is parked in a legal manner within a designate parking space accessory building or structure means any building or structure not larger than twothirds the size of the principal building or structure designed and constructed not to be used as living space but for storage purposes or the like including specifically but not limited to a garage shop studio shed workshop solar panel hot tub satellite dish radio or television antenna or similar unit alley means any public space or thoroughfare less than 20 feet but not less than ten feet in width which has been dedicated or deeded to the public for public use and which is used primarily for vehicular service access to the back or the side of properties otherwise abutting on a street alter means any structural change in the supporting or loadbearing members of a building such as bearing walls columns beams girders or floor joists alternative energy structure means any structure or element of a structure designed used or intended for use as an alternative energy system or an element of an alternative energy system which structure is designed and constructed not to be used as a living space exceeds the maximum height allowed for accessory uses when attached to an accessory building or exceeds the maximum height allowed for the principal use building when attached to the principal use building apartment house see dwelling multiple approved means sanctioned by the appropriate official as required by law so long as all provisions of these zoning regulations are met auto repair shop means a shop or place of business for repair and maintenance of automobiles trucks and other automotive and farm equipment which carry a valid title and show a work order automobile and trailer sales area means an open area other than a street used for the display sale or rental of new or used automobiles trailers and related vehicles and where no repair work is done except minor incidental repair of automobiles or trailers to be displayed sold or rented on the premises bed and breakfast means a residential property which has been modified or renovated to accommodate overnight guests for a shortterm period of less than 30 days in which the owner may reside and in which meals are served as a part of or in conjunction with the rates charged for the room block means a distinct portion or plot of land in a platted subdivision described and numbered as a block on the recorded plat of said subdivision or a distinct portion or plot of land bounded on all sides by public streets alleys or easements building means any structure used or intended for supporting or sheltering any use or occupancy see also structure building area means that portion of a lot or parcel that can be occupied by a building or structure building height of means the vertical distance at the center of a buildings principal front measured from the established street grade to the highest point of the coping of a flat roof or to the center height between the eaves and ridge for pitched roofs for buildings set back from the street line the height of the building shall be measured from the average elevation of the finished grade along the front of the building building line means a line on a plat or the theoretical line on the ground between which line and a street alley or private place no principal building or structure may be erected this is the farthest extended part of the building such as roof eaves or porches building nonconforming see nonconforming structure building principal means a building in which is conducted the main or principal use of the lot or parcel on which said building is situated including garages carports storage sheds etc which are attached to the principal building business and professional office means the office of an architect attorney dentist doctor engineer insurance broker or other similar professional person and any office used primarily for accounting correspondence research editing or administration campgrounds and recreational areas means organized campgrounds including federalowned and federaldesignated stateowned and statedesignated and municipalowned and municipaldesignated parks and campgrounds  privately owned campgrounds which are made available either with or without a fee to the public  and all public lands and surface waters of the state other than campgrounds used for picnicking camping and other recreational activities carport means a structure with a roof and at least two open sides it is considered a building church means a building together with its accessory buildings and uses where persons regularly assemble for religious worship and which building together with its accessory buildings and uses is maintained and controlled by a religious body organized to sustain public worship city council means the city of rocky ford city council clinic dental or medical means a building in which a group of physicians dentists or physicians and dentists and allied professional assistants are associated for the purpose of carrying on their professions a clinic may include a dental or medical laboratory but not facilities for inpatient care or operating rooms for major surgery see also hospital  club means a building or rooms and accessory buildings and grounds occupied by a nonprofit association of persons for the promotion of some common objective such as but not limited to literature science politics recreation and good fellowship meeting periodically limited to members with not more than onethird of the gross floor area being used for residential activity communication facility means a noninhabitable structure or tower up to 100 feet in height and accessory building supporting antennas and microwave dishes that send andor receive radio frequency signals including television and date impulses by means of electromagnetic waves individualpersonal directtohome satellite services are not included in this definition comprehensive plan means the sum of policies proposals programs maps and reports adopted and identified by the planning commission as components of the comprehensive plan condominium means an apartment house in which the apartments or dwelling units are individually owned  each owner receiving a recordable deed enabling him or her to sell mortgage exchange etc his or her unit independent of the owners of the other units in the building density means the number of dwelling units per acre of land devoted to housing and usable open space developmentally disabled home for means a home for those persons having cerebral palsy multiple sclerosis mental retardation autism and epilepsy or any other developmental disability district zone means a land area or land areas as defined by the zoning map within which the zoning regulations are uniform drivein restaurant or refreshment stand means any place or premises used for sale dispensing or serving of food refreshments or beverages to customers while they remain in their automobile duplex means a dwelling structurally connected and designed for or used exclusively as a residence by two families living independently of one another dwelling means any room or group of rooms forming a single habitable unit with facilities which are used or intended to be used by one family andor its resident domestic servants for its living sleeping and cooking and eating needs the width of any projected view of an exterior wall elevation of a residence shall not be less than 20 feet the term dwelling shall include a manufactured home which 1 is partially or entirely manufactured in a factory 2 is not less than 24 feet in width and 36 feet in length 3 is installed on an engineered permanent foundation and footer with a stem wall around the perimeter the stem wall must be a minimum of six inches of poured concrete or constructed with a sixinch concrete block 4 has brick wood or cosmetically equivalent exterior siding on all exterior walls which provides a consistent continuous facade from the bottom of the soffit top of wall section downward to the top of the exposed perimeter wall or foundation or to grade whichever is applicable and has a pitched roof 5 is certified pursuant to the national manufactured housing construction and safety standards act of 197 42 usc  540 et seq as amended and all regulations enacted pursuant thereto including any local modifications as are expressly allowed by federal law or has been certified by the state as being in compliance with the requirements of the building adopted by the state and as is enforced and administered by the colorado division of housing the term dwelling shall also include conventional stickbuilt housing but shall not include mobile homes as defined herein dwelling multiple means any building or portion thereof which is designed built leased let or hired out to be occupied or which is occupied as the home or residence of two or more families living independently of each other and doing their own cooking in the said building and shall include flats and apartments dwelling singlefamily means any building or portion thereof which contains one dwelling unit used intended or designed to be built used rented leased let or hired out to be occupied or which is occupied for living purposes dwelling unit means a single unit providing complete independent living facilities for one or more persons including permanent provisions for living sleeping eating cooking and sanitation easement means a right held by the public a corporation or persons to make use of the land of another for a limited purpose as a rite of passage educational institution means schools andor seminaries administered by churches or religious organizations  schools colleges or universities administered by public agencies  nonprofit schools colleges or universities operated under a charter or license from the state  and any nonprofit institution residence or home operated for the education of five or more students enclosed means surrounded by four walls with a roof and no contents visible engineered foundation means a foundation which by using engineering calculations or testing and by following commonly accepted engineering practices or manufacturers recommendations all components and subsystems will perform to meet health safety and functional requirements and shall include a footer and stemwall around the perimeter of the dwelling which stemwall must be a minimum of six inches of poured concrete or constructed with sixinch concrete block or as otherwise required by the manufacturers recommendations or the building by the city or as designed by a licensed engineer extended care facility means an establishment that provides lodging board and personal services for the health safety and comfort of persons residing therein this term does not apply to hospitals fabrication means the stamping cutting assembling or otherwise shaping of processed materials into useful objects excluding the refining or other initial processing of basic raw materials family means a group of persons related by blood marriage or adoption living together on the premises in a single dwelling unit or a group of not more than five individuals living in a single dwelling unit not related by blood marriage or adoption family care home means a facility for child care in a place of residence of a family for the purpose of providing family care and training for a child or children under the age of 18 years who are not related to the head of such home the term includes any family care home receiving a child or children for regular parttime or regular fulltime care and anyone receiving a child or children from any stateoperated institution for child care or from any child placement agency farming means the act or business of cultivating land and producing crops feedlot means an enclosure for the feeding of fowl sheep hogs cattle or other livestock where the livestock are kept within restricted areas where a majority of the feed is purchased rather than being produced on the same property and where the livestock are especially fed for weight gain prior to sale or slaughter floodplain means an area in and adjacent to a stream which area is subject to flooding as the result of the occurrence of an intermediate regional flood and which area thus is so adverse to past current or foreseeable construction or land use as to constitute a significant hazard to public health and safety or to property floodproofing means a combination of structural provisions changes or adjustments to lands properties and structures subject to flooding primarily for the reduction or elimination of flood damage to lands properties structures and contents of buildings in a flood hazard zone floodway zone means the channel of a stream and those portions of the adjoining floodplain which are reasonably required to carry and discharge the floodwaters of an intermediate regional flood in the context of these regulations it is the floodplain less the low hazard zone if any such low hazard zone has been designated or otherwise regulated under these regulations if no low hazard zone has been so designated or regulated then the terms floodplain and floodway zone shall be synonymous floor area gross means the sum of the gross horizontal areas measured between the exterior faces of exterior walls of the several floors of a building and accessory buildings including interior walls balconies mezzanines hallways walls basements and cellars and including the area of roofed porches patios and carports having more than one wall floor area net means the sum of the gross horizontal areas measured between the interior faces of exterior walls of the several floors of a building including all floors having onethird of their vertical dimension above grade  but excluding garages accessory store rooms andor areas roofed porches and patios carports cellars and wells frontage means that portion of a lot parcel tract or block abutting upon a street see also yard front garage means a fully enclosed structure for the parking of motor vehicles grazing means feeding or growing grasses or herbage health department means the otero county health department home occupation means a use for gain or support in a residential zone conducted on the parcel and carried on by its inhabitants and no others which use is clearly incidental and secondary to the use of the parcel for residential purposes and which does not change the character thereof hospital means any building or portion thereof used for the accommodation or nursing medical surgical or psychiatric care of sick injured or infirm persons see also clinic dental or medical hotel means a building containing six or more guest rooms intended or designed to be used which are used rented or hired out to be occupied or which are occupied for sleeping purposes by guests house guest means living quarters within a semiattached or detached accessory building located on the same premises with the principal building for use by temporary guests of the occupants of the premises intermediate regional flood means a type of flood including the water surface elevation and territorial occupation thereof which can be expected to occur at any time in a given area based upon recorded historical precipitation and other valid data but with an average statistical onepercent chance of being equaled or exceeded during any one year the term is used interchangeably with a onepercent flood or onehundredyear flood junk refuse and waste means objects material property or items which by reason of their location and character are dangerous to public health safety or welfare are unsightly interfere with the reasonable enjoyment of the property by neighbors detrimentally affect property values in the surrounding neighborhood or community or which would materially hamper or interfere with the prevention or suppression of fire upon the premises junk refuse and waste includes but is not limited to rubbish refuse debris rubble asphalt concrete plaster tile rocks bricks soil crates cartons containers boxes inoperable machinery or parts thereof scrap metal and other pieces of metal whether ferrous or nonferrous dead plants and trees trimmings from plants and trees cans bottles barrels bones rags used rubber or used rope junk refuse and waste shall also include any material or object used or new which is not presently usable including but not limited to scrap metals in their alloy bones rags cloth rubber pieces rope tinfoil bottles tools fixtures utensils lumber boxes crates pipe or pipe fittings automobile or airplane tires machinery and appliances objects or material shall be considered junk if they are so worn deteriorated or obsolete as to make them unusable in their existing condition if they are not capable of being used in their present location on the property or if they cannot legally be used due to the absence of the legal prerequisites to use and shall specifically include junked or abandoned vehicles junk or abandoned vehicle means any    691998   3 2231999   1262010   292016   5222018  article 2  administration duties of zoning administrator all permits certifications and stop orders required by this be issued by the zoning administrator who shall have the authority to make all decisions and investigations necessary to properly carry out the provisions of this zoning administrator shall determine whether a use is similar to those uses listed unless his or her decision is reversed by the planning commission no required permit certificate or order shall be issued by the zoning administrator if in his or her judgment the requirements of this not been met no oversight or dereliction on the part of the zoning administrator or on the part of any official or employee of the city shall legalize or authorize the violations of any of the provisions of this    292016 right of entry the zoning administrator shall if possible first secure permission of the occupant before entering upon any premises for the purpose of making any inspection necessary to the conduct of his or her duties in the administration and enforcement of this    292016 zoning permits permits shall be secured from the zoning administrator prior to the construction moving conversion extension enlargement or structural alteration of buildings or other structures including fences 1 application forms application for a zoning permit shall be made to the zoning administrator on forms provided for that purpose 2 premises diagram each application shall include a diagram of the premises containing a the dimensions of the lot or parcel of land b the location of relevant lot boundary lines determined by existing survey pins except that the zoning administrator may waive this requirement where the zoning administrators personal inspection of the property discloses that the exact location of the lot lines is not at issue for the issuance of the permit c the location and dimension of each structure on the premises including the proposed project d the distance from the outermost extensions of the proposed project to the relevant lot lines 3 application fee a nonrefundable zoning permit application fee as set forth in the citys fee schedule shall be submitted with the completed application form the city council may amend this fee from time to time by resolution or ordinance 4 issuance if in the opinion of the zoning administrator the proposal as set forth in the application and verified by personal inspection of the zoning administrator is in conformance with the provisions of this the zoning administrator shall issue a zoning permit 5 disapproval if in the opinion of the zoning administrator the proposal as set forth in the application and verified by personal inspection of the zoning administrator is not in conformance with the provisions of this the zoning administrator shall refuse to issue a zoning permit and shall state in writing on the application or an attachment to the application the reason for such disapproval 6 null or void permits a any permit issued in violation of any provision of this be null and void and may not be construed as waiving any provision of this a zoning permit once issued under the provisions of this shall be valid for 12 months where the applicant fails to commence construction within the 12month limit the zoning permit shall be null and void    691998     292016 stop orders whenever any building work is being done contrary to the provisions of this land or structures are being used contrary to this the zoning administrator shall order the work or use stopped by notice in writing served on any person engaged in doing or causing such work to be done or such use to be continued and any such person and all others engage in doing or causing such work to be done or such use to be continued shall forthwith stop such work or use until authorized by the zoning administrator to proceed with the work or continue the use    292016 appeals any person denied a permit or certificate or issued a stop order may appeal such action of the zoning administrator to the planning commission within 30 days from the date of such action by the zoning administrator    292016 article 3  planning commission duties of planning commission the planning commission is hereby authorized 1 to hear and decide on special use permits required by the terms of this 2 to hear and decide appeals for a variance from the zoning administrators actions 3 to hear and decide appeals for a variance from the strict application of this 4 to receive testimony under oath and make such studies and surveys as are required to carry out the duties herein outlined 5 to request information or opinions from any administrative officer of the city or any other person considered an expert on the matter 6 to attach such requirements conditions andor reviews to actions on applications presented to it as it believes necessary to carry out the intent and purposes of this    292016 application form any person requesting a special use permit or making an appeal to the planning commission shall submit a written application on a form provided by the city clerk for that purpose    292016 fees accompanying each application shall be a fee as set forth in the citys fee schedule plus the costs of legal advertising which costs must be paid before the hearing for said application is scheduled fees shall be made payable to the city of rocky ford in the event the planning commission determines that a hearing for a special use permit or use by review was not necessary or required or that any appeal from the actions of the zoning administrator is upheld said application fee shall be refunded to the applicant except as specifically provided herein the application fee or any part thereof shall not be refunded    2231999   292016 public hearings a all actions of the planning commission shall be taken at public hearings b notice of a hearing shall include the time date and place of the hearing a brief description of the request and a legal description and the street address of such property in question c the notice shall be given no less than 15 days prior to the hearing d the notice shall be published in a newspaper of general circulation e the notice shall be sent by certified mail to the applicant f the notice shall also be distributed to all the property owners within 350 feet of the property in question    292016 special use permit before granting a special use permit the planning commission shall find in writing based upon evidence and testimony that all of the following conditions exist 1 the requested use is a use listed as a use by review in the district in which the parcel is located 2 the granting of the special use permit will not substantially modify the comprehensive plan or the intent purpose and spirit of this 3 the special use proposal incorporates reasonable means to create an environment harmonious with that to the surrounding properties 4 the special use will not adversely affect the public health safety or welfare    292016 appeal time limit appeals to the planning commission may be made in writing at any time but if for relief from any action by the zoning administrator it must be made within 30 days from the date on which any person was aggrieved by an action of the zoning administrator notice of such appeal shall be filed with the zoning administrator and he or she shall transmit said appeal to the secretary of the planning commission within 15 days along with all records upon which the action was taken and a written statement indicating his or her findings of fact and his or her reasons for the action for which the appeal is made    292016 appeal from zoning administrator before granting an appeal from actions of the zoning administrator the planning commission shall find in writing based on evidence and testimony that all of the following conditions exist 1 the granting of the appeal will permit only those uses listed in the zone district in which the parcel is located 2 the action of the zoning administrator was arbitrary capricious or not in harmony with the provisions purposes intent and spirit of this    292016 request for variance from zoning regulations before granting a variance the planning commission shall find in writing based upon evidence and testimony that all of the following conditions exist 1 the variance if granted will permit only those uses listed as a use permitted in the zone district in which the parcel is located 2 the parcel for which the variance appeal is made suffers unique or singular disadvantages such as but not limited to size shape topography location or surroundings not shared by other parcels in the neighborhood 3 the variance will not grant privileges inconsistent with limitations shared by other parcels in the zone district 4 the variance will not have an injurious effect on the existing or future use of the adjacent parcels 5 the variance will not injure or adversely alter the general character of the neighborhood in which the variance is sought 6 the variance request is in harmony with the intent purpose and spirit of this    292016 actions a all actions of the planning commission shall be in writing shall contain the required findings of fact and shall include a statement setting forth those factors which the planning commission considered controlling factors in reaching its decision b any appeals granted by the planning commission shall not be personal to the applicant but shall be transferable and shall run with the land except that the appeals granted must be exercised in full or construction started within not more than one year from the date of granting such appeal  otherwise the appeal granted shall become null and void and the parcel shall thereafter be subject to all the applicable regulations of this    292016 reapplication in the event a variance special use or appeal from an action of the zoning administrator is denied no new applications for a hearing shall be made for the same or a substantially similar condition within six months of such denial    292016 legal remedy the findings and decisions of the planning commission shall be final appeals to the district court shall be made within 30 days from the date of the action by the planning commission    292016 article 4  district the planning commission based upon the requirements of comparable uses listed c in the event several uses occupy a single structure or parcel of land the total requirements for offstreet parking shall be the sum of the requirements of the several uses computed separately d owners of two or more uses structures or parcels of land may agree to jointly utilize the same parking and loading spaces when the hours of operation do not overlap provided that satisfactory legal evidence is presented to the zoning administrator in the form of deeds leases or contracts to establish the joint use e required the parking of trucks used for conducting the business or use    292016 offstreet parking at the time of erection of a new structure or at the time of enlargement or change in use of an existing
