article 7  signs purpose the purpose of this to define the types of signs that will be permitted in the various zoning districts and those that will be prohibited the manner in which sign areas and dimensions will be measured and the exemption of certain types of signs from this is further the intent of this encourage the erection of signs which are attractive and compatible with adjacent property and which will preserve and enhance property values within the city    292016 general standards the following regulations shall apply to all signs either accessory or nonaccessory in all zoning districts regardless of designation 1 signs in need of paint broken signs and signs of vacated buildings shall be removed from the premises or repaired or renovated by the owners of the premises on order of the zoning administrator 2 signs pertaining to special events which refer to particular periods or points of time such as meetings sales exhibitions and vacancy announcements shall be permitted provided that such signs shall be removed when no longer applicable 3 along streets and roads no sign shall obscure the vision or views of the natural landscape or the larger urban area nor shall any sign be distracting to motorists or create a traffic hazard 4 no sign shall be erected at the intersection of any street or road in such a manner as to obstruct clear vision  nor shall any sign be erected at a location where by reason of its position shape or color it may interfere with obstruct the view of or be confused with any traffic sign or traffic control device 5 signs shall not be erected on a city rightofway    292016 permitted accessory signs in residential districts in residential districts no sign shall be erected or maintained except under the following conditions 1 no sign shall be erected on the roof of any building 2 signs shall not be illuminated by or contain flashing intermittent rotating or moving lights 3 no sign or part thereof shall contain or consist of ribbons streamers spinners or smaller moving fluttering or revolving devices such devices as well as strings of lights shall not be used for the purposes of advertising or attracting 4 owner or occupant signs a sign identifying property or the name of the owner or occupant of property is allowable provided that such sign is not in excess of two square feet in area and only one such sign is erected on any single lot or parcel 5 for lease or sale signs signs pertaining to the lease or sale of the property on which the sign is located or any building thereon are allowable provided that such signs do not exceed four square feet in area per sign and further that not more than two signs are located on any single lot or parcel 6 church signs a sign or entrance marker for each church is allowable provided that such sign does not exceed 20 square feet in area 7 contractor signs one sign may be maintained by the contractor during construction of the building but shall not exceed 12 square feet in area 8 business or home occupation signs signs pertaining to a business operated out of the home or building is allowed provided that it does not exceed four square feet and no more than one sign is located on the property    292016 permitted accessory signs in commercial and industrial districts in local commercial highway commercial and industrial districts accessory signs shall not be erected or maintained except in conformity with the following regulations 1 an accessory sign shall identify only the name of the owner trade name trade mark product symbol products sold andor the business or activity conducted on the premises whereon such sign is located 2 signs along the highway must conform to the state sign laws 3 commercial or industrial offpremises signs are not allowed 4 symbolic signs such as a barber pole mortar and pestle etc which are traditional in nature and size shall be permitted 5 directional signs not to exceed two square feet in area may be erected as needed    292016 nonaccessory signs no outdoor advertising sign billboard or other advertising media not directly related to the use of the premises on which it is located shall be permitted in any district except as a use by review in such districts as is hereinafter provided any nonaccessory sign permitted as a conditional use shall be in harmony with the spirit and intent of this    292016 public agency signs the provisions of this not apply to signs erected by national state county or municipal governmental agencies including traffic and informational signs    292016 removal of signs any sign existing on or after the date of enactment of the zoning ordinance codified herein identifying a business or activity which no longer exists or a product which is no longer sold on the premises shall be removed by the owner of the premises upon written notice of the zoning administrator the zoning administrator upon determining that such sign exists shall notify the owner of the premises in writing to remove such sign within six months of the date of the notice or upon expiration of the lease agreement    292016 article 8  nonconforming uses structures and signs purpose any use of a lot structure or sign that existed immediately prior to the adoption of the zoning ordinance codified herein which does not conform to the provisions of this the time of adoption shall be known as a nonconforming use nonconforming lot nonconforming structure or nonconforming sign    292016 nonconforming use a continuation of nonconforming use  a nonconforming use may be continued but shall not be enlarged without approval by the planning commission b discontinuance of nonconforming use  if a nonconforming use is discontinued from a use for a period of six months further use of the property shall be for a conforming use unless the use is of a seasonal character  then a period of 12 months shall apply vacancy of a dwelling while the dwelling is listed with a real estate broker shall not constitute discontinuance of a nonconforming use c change of nonconforming use  if a nonconforming use is changed it shall be changed to a use conforming to the regulations of the district and after change it shall not be changed back again to the original nonconforming use      292016 nonconforming structure a alteration or enlargement  a structure not conforming as to height setback or coverage may be altered or enlarged provided that the alteration or enlargement does not result in a violation of this b destruction of nonconforming structure or structure having nonconforming use  1 if a nonconforming structure or a structure containing a nonconforming use is destroyed by fire flood wind explosion or other act to the extent exceeding 50 percent of the cost of replacement of the structure using new materials a future structure or use on the property shall conform to the provisions of this the destroyed structure contained a nonconforming use as a dwelling and where the nonconforming use had not been discontinued prior to the destruction the replacement use may be as a dwelling 2 if destruction is determine to be less than 50 percent restoration must be started within 12 months of such calamity and completed within 24 months of initiating restoration      292016 nonconforming lots of record a no structure shall be erected or enlarged on a nonconforming lot without approval of the planning commission b if two or more lots or combinations of lots and portions of lots with continuous frontage in single ownership are of record at the time of adoption or amendment of the zoning ordinance codified herein and part or all of said lots do not meet the requirements of the district in which they are located as to minimum area or frontage or both the lands shall be considered for the purpose of this an undivided parcel no portion of said parcel shall be sold or used in a manner which diminishes compliance with lot width and area requirements established by this    292016 nonconforming signs no sign may be enlarged or altered in such a manner as to increase its nonconformity  provided however that any sign or portion thereof may be altered to decrease its nonconformity    292016 completion of structure or building nothing contained in this require any change in the plans construction alteration or designated use of a building for which construction work has commenced prior to the adoption of the zoning ordinance codified herein    292016 article 9  zoning amendments and map changes amendments any portion of this or the zoning map may be changed whenever the public necessity health safety general welfare andor good zoning practices justify such action any such change shall be made only by the city council    292016 initiation of amendment an ordinance for the amendment of any portion of this of any zone district boundaries may be initiated by any member of the city council or the planning commission an administrative officer of the city or one or more of the owners of the property within the area for which the amendment is requested the request for such change shall be submitted in writing to the zoning administrator on a form provided for that purpose    292016 fees all requests for amendments to this the zoning map except those initiated by the city council the planning commission or any administrative office of the city shall be accompanied by a fee as set forth in the citys fee schedule plus the cost of legal advertising which costs shall be paid and a receipt therefor presented to the planning commission secretary before the hearing for said application is scheduled fees shall be made payable to the city of rocky ford the zoning administrator shall receive the application for an amendment and all supporting documents to be transmitted to the secretary of the planning commission within ten working days of its receipt by the zoning administrator    292016 action of secretary of planning commission upon receipt of the application or an amendment and all supporting documentation as transmitted by the zoning administrator the secretary of the planning commission shall cause said application to be placed on the agenda of the next planning commission meeting the secretary shall submit a written or verbal report of the application its documentation and such other information as he or she deems pertinent    292016 planning commission action a at the meeting at which the application is on the agenda for first consideration the planning commission shall receive and file the application documentation and written report of the secretary hear or receive and file a presentation by the applicant and set a date and time for a public hearing which date shall not be later than 60 days from receipt of such application b the planning commission shall cause notice to be published as required by law at least once in a newspaper of general circulation in the city not less than 15 days prior to the public hearing and if for a change in the zoning map shall cause notice of the public hearing on the proposed changes to be sent to owners of the lots included in such proposed change those property owners with property within 350 feet of the new zone boundary and such other persons as in the judgment of the secretary should be notified such notice shall be given not less than 15 days before the date set for the hearing such notice may be served by depositing the same properly addressed and postage paid in the post office    292016 hearing and findings the planning commission shall hold a public hearing and may recommend approval or disapproval of the proposed amendment in whole or in part the action of the planning commission shall be in writing shall contain the following findings of fact and shall include a statement setting forth those factors which the planning commission considered to be controlling factors in reaching its decision 1 the proposed amendment is in conformance with the comprehensive plan 2 the change requested promotes the public necessity health safety and general welfare and is consistent with good land use and zoning practices    292016 referral of recommendation the recommendation shall within 60 days of receipt thereof be referred to the city council and an ordinance embodying the recommendation in whole or in part may be adopted by the city council after a public hearing thereon as required by law    292016 mandatory review during the first 30 days following the oneyear anniversary of the effective date of any ordinance changing the zoning map the planning commission shall review the proposed development of the subject area in the field to determine whether the development intended by the amendment is being undertaken in good faith if such development is not underway in keeping with said intent the planning commission may initiate action to rezone the subject area back to the classification it had prior to the change in zoning or to any other more appropriate classification    292016 reapplication in the event the proposed amendment is denied by the city council no new request for the same or a substantially similar amendment shall be heard by the city council within one year of such denial    292016 legal remedy the findings and decisions of the city council shall be final appeals to the district court shall be made within 30 days from the date of the city councils action    292016 article 10  violations and penalties violation it is unlawful for any person either as owner lessee occupant or otherwise to erect construct reconstruct alter maintain or use any building or structure or to use any land in violation of the provisions of this any amendment thereof    292016 penalties for violations a any person who violates this fails to comply with any of its requirements shall upon conviction thereof be fined in accordance with the provisions of of this   and in addition shall pay all costs and expenses involved in the case including reasonable attorney fees b the owner or tenant of any building structure premises or part thereof and any architect builder contractor agent or other person who commits participates in assists in or maintains such violation may each be found guilty of a separate offense and suffer the penalties herein provided c nothing herein contained shall prevent the city from taking such other lawful action as is necessary to prevent or remedy any violation    292016 article 11  marijuana cultivation for personal use purpose and legislative intent this local law to assure provisions of hb 171220 codified in crs  1818406 regarding the maximum number of marijuana plants that may be cultivated grown or produced on a residential property may be enforced within the city of rocky ford   definitions residential property in this a single unit providing complete independent living facilities for one or more persons including permanent provisions for living sleeping eating cooking and sanitation residential property also includes the real property surrounding a structure owned in common with the structure that includes one or more single units providing complete independent living facilities   prohibitions effective  no person shall knowingly possess at cultivate grow or produce more than 12 marijuana plants on or in a residential property regardless of whether the plants are for medical or recreational use and regardless of the number of persons residing temporarily or permanently on the residential property   chapter 17  subdivisions article 1  general provisions purpose these regulations are designed and enacted for the purpose of providing for the proper arrangement of streets in relation to other existing or planned streets and to the master plan for adequate access and convenience to open spaces for traffic utilities access of firefighting apparatus recreation light and air and for the avoidance of congestion of population including minimum area and width of lots    292016 short title for the purpose of brevity these regulations shall be referred to as the rocky ford subdivision regulations or this     292016 authority a the rocky ford subdivision regulations are authorized by state statutes and are hereby declared to be in accordance with all provisions of those statutes b any person being the owner or agent of any land located within a subdivision who transfers sells agrees to sell or negotiates to sell any land by reference to exhibition of or use of a plat of a subdivision before such plat has been approved by the planning commission and recorded or filed in the office of the county clerk and recorder shall forfeit and pay a penalty of $10000 for each lot or parcel so transferred sold or agreed or negotiated to be sold the description of such lot or parcel by metes and bounds in the instrument of transfer or other document used in the process of selling or transferring shall not exempt the transaction from such penalties or from the remedies provided in this city may enjoin such transfer of sale or agreement by action for injunction brought in any court of equity jurisdiction or may recover the penalty by civil action in any court of competent jurisdiction    292016 jurisdiction the territory of jurisdiction of the planning commission over the subdivision of land shall include all land located within the legal boundaries of the city and limited only to control with reference to a major street plan and not otherwise and shall also include all land lying within three miles of the corporate limits of the city and not located in any other municipality however in the case of any such nonmunicipal land lying within five miles of more than one municipality the jurisdiction of each municipal planning commission shall terminate at a boundary line equidistant from the respective corporate limits of the city and such other municipality    292016 public dedication all plans of streets or highways for public use and all plans plats plots and replots of land laid out in a subdivision or building lots and the streets highways alleys or other portions of the same intended to be dedicated to a public use or the use of purchasers or owners of lots fronting thereon shall be submitted to the planning commission for approval before they are recorded acceptance of said proposed dedication by the public shall be given by action of the planning commission    292016 words and terms a the word shall is always mandatory and directory  and may is permissive b words used in the present tense include the future unless the context clearly indicates the contrary c words used in the singular number include the plural and words used in the plural number include the singular unless the context clearly indicates the contrary 04   292016 definitions for the purpose of this certain words and terms are hereby defined as follows development means the act of building structures and installing site improvements resubdivision means 1 substandard lots of record that are combined into larger more saleable plots in keeping with contemporary development ideas and in which new streets are opened up or in which a recombination of the lots constitutes a development 2 small parcels and strips transferred to adjoining owners in order to make minor property line adjustments 3 adequate or abovestandard size either fully serviced or unserviced that are divided or recombined in such a way that none falls below standards but the marketability of the land is increased subdivision means the division of a lot tract or parcel of land into two or more lots plats sites or other divisions of land for the purpose whether immediate or future of sale or of building development it includes resubdivision and when appropriate to the context relates to the process of subdividing or to the land or territory subdivided 04   292016 article 2  administration variances for hardship the planning commission may authorize variances from the terms of this by reason of exceptional topographic conditions or other extraordinary and exceptional situations or conditions of a tract of land the strict application of any regulation contained herein would result in peculiar and exceptional practical difficulties to or exceptional and undue hardship upon the subdivider  provided that such relief may be granted without substantial detriment to the public good and without substantially impairing the intent and purpose of this 12   292016 amendments the planning commission and the city council may amend the requirements of this giving public notice of any such proposed amendment and after holding a public hearing thereon 14   292016 interpretation in the interpretation and application of the provisions of this the following regulation shall govern 1 provisions are minimum requirements in their interpretation and application the provisions of this be regarded as the minimum requirements for the protection of the public health safety comfort morals convenience prosperity and welfare this therefore be regarded as remedial and shall be liberally construed to further its underlying purposes 2 application of overlapping regulations whenever any provision of this any provision of any other law ordinance resolution rule or regulation of any kind contain restrictions covering the same subject matter whichever restrictions are more restrictive or impose higher standards or requirements shall govern 3 existing permits and private agreements this not intended to abrogate or annul a any permits issued before the effective date of the original ordinance codified herein  or b any easement covenant or other private agreement provided that it is not in conflict with the provisions of this 16   292016 severability it is hereby declared to be the legislative intent that the several provisions of this be severable in accordance with the provisions set forth below 1 if any provision is declared invalid by a decision of any court of competent jurisdiction it is hereby declared to be the legislative intent that a the effect of such decision shall be limited to that provision which is expressly stated in the decision to be invalid  and b such decision shall not affect impair or nullify this a whole or any other part thereof but the rest of this continue in full force and effect 2 if the application of any provision of this any tract of land is declared to be invalid by a decision of any court of competent jurisdiction it is hereby declared to be the legislative intent that a the effect of such decision shall be limited to that tract of land immediately involved in the controversy action or proceeding in which the judgment or decree of invalidity was rendered  and b such decision shall not affect impair or nullify this a whole or the application of any provision thereof to any other tract of land 18   292016 repeal all ordinances and resolutions of the city inconsistent herewith to the extent of such inconsistency and no further are hereby repealed the repeal of any of said ordinances and resolutions does not revive any other ordinance or resolution or portion thereof repealed by said ordinance or resolution such repeals shall not affect or prevent the prosecution or punishment of any person for the violation of any ordinance or resolution repealed hereby for an offense committed prior to the repeal 20   292016 article 3  procedure for submission of plats preapplication a conference with the chairperson of the planning commission is recommended in order to become familiar with the provisions of this with the city engineer building inspector and other city officials on the availability of services and facilities in the area to be subdivided    292016 sketch map a the purpose of the sketch map is to resolve points of disagreement before the subdivider goes to the expense of designing and drawing the preliminary plat and engineering drawings b the sketch map shall be submitted to the planning commission for review the planning commission shall review the sketch map with the subdivider at the next regularly scheduled planning commission meeting c the sketch map shall show on a topographic or other suitable base map in a preliminary form the proposed layout of streets and lots  existing and proposed covenants  utilities available  the number and size of residential lots  building types sizes and price range  parks playgrounds and school areas  and any commercial use proposed d in addition the sketch map shall include a location map showing the relationship of the proposed subdivision to traffic arteries public transportation shopping areas schools and churches e a time schedule should be submitted if only part of the subdivision is to be developed at one time f the sketch map should be approximately to scale but does not need to be mechanically drawn g the planning commission shall have approval subject to suggested changes to be incorporated in the preliminary plat and engineering drawings    292016 preliminary plat and engineering drawings a the preliminary plat drawings are those from which construction work on the subdivision can proceed it is a drawing on which final review for adherence to design standards and improvement proposals is based before construction of a proposed subdivision is started it may have to be modified before approval but changes should be minor b if the situation is changed  for example if a highway is being built across the proposed subdivision then the preliminary plat may be invalidated and a new sketch map required c if the planning commission approves the plat the subdivider may proceed with the installation of site improvements subject to obtaining work permits from the city engineer and proceed with preparation of the final plat d if after one year improvements have not been started approval of the preliminary plat shall expire e the preliminary plat and engineering drawings shall show or be accompanied by 1 names and addresses of the subdivider the designer of the subdivision and the engineer or surveyor who shall be licensed by the colorado board of examiners for engineers and land surveyors 2 name of the subdivision 3 topography at fivefoot intervals or less 4 location and results of soil percolation tests if individual sewage disposal systems are proposed 5 zoning on the tract 6 date of preparation scale not less than one inch equals 200 feet and north arrow indicating true north 7 primary control points approved by the city engineer or descriptions and ties to such control points to which all dimensions angles bearings and similar data on the plat shall be referred 8 location and description of monuments 9 location and principal dimensions for all proposed areas to be reserved for parks schools or other public uses 10 proposed sites if any for multifamily residential use business areas industrial areas churches and other nonpublic uses exclusive of singlefamily residential areas 11 number to identify each lot or site and block number in conformance with the city system 12 site data including number of residential lots typical lot size and total acres in the subdivisions 13 location and dimensions angles bearings lines and radii and arcs of a utilities  b tract boundary lines  c streets including their names  d easements and other rightsofway  e property lines of residential lots and other sites  f   and g alleys 14 a map showing the relationship of the proposed plat to the surrounding area including zoning on the property adjacent to the tract the names of abutting subdivisions or the names of the owners of abutting unplatted property and reference to permanent survey monuments with a tie to a section corner or a quartersection corner the engineering drawings are to furnish more details including profiles and crosssections of site improvements and grading plans for streets and lots for regulations governing these drawings the subdivider should see the city engineers regulations f progressive subdivision 1 the final plat may be submitted covering only a portion of the area covered by the preliminary plat 2 provided that the partial final plats are submitted within nine months of each other the period between approvals can extend up to three years 3 the planning commission the city engineer and the subdivider may agree on a the installation of offsite improvements and connecting links such as roads and sewers that are outside the area covered by the partial plat but are needed to provide access and services to it b the amount of performance guarantee g ten copies of the preliminary plat and required supplemental material shall be presented by the subdivider to the secretary of the planning commission at least ten days prior to a regular planning commission meeting h at the next regular planning commission meeting the preliminary plat shall be reviewed in general and if acceptable shall be referred by the planning commission to the following offices for study city engineers office electric companies gas companies telephone companies cities and towns located within three miles of the area to be subdivided school districts and where applicable special utility districts and the colorado department of transportation each of these offices shall return their recommendations to the planning commission within 20 days of receipt of its copy of the preliminary plat if not received by this time the planning commission shall proceed without its recommendations i at the next regular planning commission meeting following discussions with the subdivider on changes deemed advisable and the kind and extent of improvements to be made by the subdivider the planning commission shall disapprove approve as submitted or approve as modified the preliminary plat such approval of a preliminary plat shall be conditional for purposes of guidance in the preparation of the final plat    292016 final plat a the final plat is a record of the subdivision as surveyed in the field the items to be shown are the same as those on the preliminary plat but once work is started on the site minor changes in property line and utility layout to meet surveying and installations problems are to be expected the final plat shall record these minor changes but it should closely agree with the preliminary plat changes that are in violation of this not permitted b building permits shall not be issued except for work permits for construction that is part of the required utility system until the final plat is approved c approval of the final plat is given only if improvements have been installed according to plan or if a performance guarantee approved by the city attorney or finance director has been given by the subdivider for those improvements not yet installed d approval of the final plat does not constitute acceptance of preferred dedications dedications can only be accepted by the city council e drawings shall be made at a scale of one inch equals ten feet with india ink or some other equally substantial solution on vellum or other stable base such as mylar good draftsmanship shall be required in order for all information shown on the final plat to be accurate and legible f the following information shall be required on the final plat or information accompanying it 1 certification of title showing that the applicant is the land owner 2 statement by the owner dedicating streets rightsofway and any sites for public uses 3 certification by a surveyor or engineer certifying to the accuracy of the survey and plat 4 certification showing approval by the planning commission g processing of the final plat shall be not more than 12 months after approval of the preliminary plat h the original and three copies of the final plat and required supplemental material shall be presented by the subdivider to the secretary of the planning commission provided that such time is at least ten days prior to a regular planning commission meeting i at the next regular planning commission meeting not less than 60 days the planning commission shall check the final plat for conformity with the approved preliminary plat and other requirements of this shall approve as submitted or disapprove the final plat j recording 1 not more than three months after approval of the final plat by the planning commission the subdivider shall record the final plat in the office of the county clerk and recorder  otherwise the approving action of the planning commission shall be deemed to have been withdrawn 2 the subdivider shall immediately upon recording furnish the city engineer with three copies of the final plat as officially recorded k a final survey of utilities as installed shall be submitted to the city engineer the survey can be a simplified version of the engineering drawings but it should record any necessary minor changes of location that may be made in the course of construction certificates of improvements completion will be withheld until this survey is made l the fee for approval of the final plat shall be as set forth in the citys fee schedule    292016 article 4  design standards streets a the design standards shall be coordinated with the zoning map and of this with the development policy and future land use plan b development in floodplain land must comply with the requirements of of this c the arrangement width grade and location of all shall conform to the city circulation plan streets shall be considered in their relation to existing and planned streets to topographical conditions and to public convenience and safety and in their appropriate relation to the proposed use of the land to be served d local streets shall be laid out so that their use by will be discouraged e streets shall be laid out so as to intersect as nearly as possible at right angles f street rightofway widths shall be not less than 50 feet g halfstreets shall be prohibited except where an existing halfstreet is adjacent to a tract to be subdivided the other half of the street shall be platted h deadend streets designed to be so permanently shall not be longer than 300 feet and shall be provided at the closed end with a turnaround having an outside roadway diameter of at least 100 feet and a street property line diameter of at least 110 feet i no street names shall be used which will duplicate or be confused with the names of existing streets street names shall be subject to the approval of the planning commission j street grades wherever feasible and with due allowance for reasonably vertical curves shall not exceed seven percent k no street grade shall be less than onehalf percent    292016 alleys a alleys shall be provided in all districts except that the planning commission may waive this requirement where other definite provision is made for service access and parking adequate for the uses proposed b the width of an alley shall be 20 feet c deadend alleys shall be avoided where possible but if unavoidable shall be provided with adequate turnaround facilities at the deadend    292016 easements a easements across lots or centered on rear or side lot lines shall be provided for utilities where necessary and shall be at least ten feet wide b where a subdivision is traversed by a water course drainage way channel or stream there shall be provided a stormwater easement or drainage rightofway conforming substantially with the lines of such water course and such further width as may be required for the construction of necessary flood control measures    292016 blocks the lengths widths and shapes of blocks shall be determined with due regard to 1 provision of adequate building sites suitable to the special needs of the type of use contemplated 2 zoning requirements as to lot sizes and dimensions 3 needs for convenient access circulation control and safety of street traffic 4 limitations and opportunities of topography a block lengths shall not exceed 600 feet or be less than 300 feet b pedestrian crosswalks not less than four and onehalf feet wide shall be required where deemed essential to provide circulation or access to schools playgrounds shopping centers and other community facilities    292016 a residential lot dimensions shall conform to the requirements of of this b doublefrontage and reversefrontage lots should be avoided except where essential to provide separation of residential development from expressways and major arterial streets or to overcome specific disadvantages of topography and orientation a planting screen easement of at least ten feet in width and across which there shall be no right of access may be required along the property line of lots abutting such traffic artery or other disadvantageous use c side lot lines shall be substantially at right angles or radial to street lines    292016 article 5  improvements engineering drawings the following items shall be required prior to the start of construction 1 approval of the drawings 2 exhibits 3 source of the drawings 4 qualifications of contractors 5 time schedule and sequence of construction 6 modification of design of improvements during construction 7 asbuilt drawings    292016 required improvements the following improvements shall be required prior to approval of the development 1 policy on sharing cost of oversize improvements 2 monuments 3 grading 4 streets 5 storm drainage 6 culverts and bridges 7 curbs and gutters 8 sidewalks 9 street trees 10 street signs 11 street lights 12 water supply 13 fire hydrants 14 sanitary sewers and facilities 15 planting screens 16 guarantees of performance a form and amount b conditions c duration and release d extension of time e default 17 maintenance bonds 18 protection and repair of existing improvements    292016 inspection of improvements the following items shall be required for inspection of improvements 1 inspection required 2 notification 3 timing 4 reports 5 subdivider responsible in any case 6 approval not acceptance 7 fees    292016 article 6  cost of improvements responsibility for costs the owner and subdivider of any subdivision as defined in below shall pay and be responsible for the cost and installation of water and sewer utility lines to and within such subdivision in addition such owner and subdivider shall pay and be responsible for the installation of streets sidewalks curbs and gutters within such subdivision 22   292016 definition the terms subdivision is defined as follows any parcel of land in the city of rocky ford which is divided into two or more parcels separate interests or interests in common with the following exceptions 1 the term subdivision shall not apply to any division of land which creates parcels of land each of which comprises 35 acres or more of land none of which is intended for use by multiple owners 2 the term subdivision shall not apply to any division of land which is a created by order of any court in the state or by operation of law  b created by a lien mortgage deed of trust or any other security instrument  or c created by security or a unit of interest in any investment trust regulated under the laws of the state or any other interest in an investment entity 22   292016 specifications installation of utilities streets sidewalks curbs and gutters within a subdivision shall
